review_text: Don't know how many places has a paved trail through the woods like this.  I was able to push our baby around the loop, stop by the beach for a break.  Not the biggest park and the trails (the ones not paved) look pretty easy.  Some people ride their bikes.  Picnic tables near the beach area.  Great for families.

Beautiful trails and wildlife all around.
Fellow hikers are friendly and dogs are welcome here. I like that some trails are paved to make this forest wheelchair and stroller accessible.
There's free parking and a playground.
Some of the peaks offer views of the North Shore to Boston.
Beautiful, clean and well kept paths. Lots of off trail options. I come here to hold photoshoots as well and it's always a blast.

I LOVE it here. There are so many trails and it's so beautiful & scenic. I always feel good & in tune with nature when I go here. They are dog-friendly too, which is great! Parking can be tricky if it's busy but I've never not found a spot (sometimes park in the side Target lot..an officer once told me that it was okay to do.) I highly recommend visiting here if you haven't before.

Breakheart reservation: This is another amazing place to visit for Hiking, Biking , Horseback riding, Swimming , Fishing  Cross-country skiing   and educational programs.

The park was established in 1934.

Breakheart reservation is a public recreation covering about 652 acres (264 ha) across towns of Saugus and Wakefield, Massachusetts.

Was here with friends, and it's an inspiring experience for me. I would commend anyone who wishes to experience quite a movement nature to do a visit here.

Though, I was not able to take pictures showing all of the facilities, but they have the following:

1) Visitor center: The park is headquartered at Christopher P. Dunne Visitor Center, which opened in 2004. In addition to restrooms, educational programs, and information, the center has displays and exhibits that introduce aspects of the forest's wildlife and human history.

2) Swimming: The beach at the north end of Pearce Lake also has a first aid station during the summer months. I took a few pictures at the lake. The lake was divided into some parts, which shows areas considered too dangerous to swim  through.

3) Trails: Trails are available for hiking, mountain biking, and cross-country skiing.
The park also offers fishing, orienteering, a tot lot, and a play area for dogs and their owners, Bark Place.

The reservation is free and open to everyone.

Let me show you some nice pictures I am sharing with you.

Use to be the spot!!! now just completely disappointed . Life guard are sleeping in there shed. While walking by their door No one cleans up at all here. can't even swim without being covered with algae and weeds. Just disgusted by their appearance and lack of. Goggle update photo cause it's nothing like you presented.

I wouldn't recommend. It's a mile walk to a really gross pond that hasn't been up kept. The life guards literally won't just relax and whistle and tell at the kids. Hardly swim able. There's lots of space for picnicking but good luck on the walk with your stuff. And dont get your hopes up for a swimable day it's like mucky swamp water.

Our walking group followed the Ash Trail. What a beautiful area! The trail was a fairly easy one. I think we were all quite amazed at the size of this reservation, the number of trails and the options for outdoor recreation there were. We will definitely be back!

place_name: Saugus Iron Works National Historic Site
review_text: Good views. Quiet place during the off-season. Check to ensure it's open for the season before you go. Restroom and water fountains were open in May. Not handicapped accessible as there are stairs going down to parts of the park. Would be a great site for kids to visit. Lots of great views.

place_name: Saugus Iron Works National Historic Site
review_text:
Went during the off season and used the NPS App to listen to an audio tour. Will return in June when it opens but recommend it even when it is closed. Plenty of parking. There are lawns and picnic area along with chairs.

Returned in June 2024. Took ranger led tour. They were great. Took us into each building and explained how everything works. Took videos and pictures and received answers to our many questions.

place_name: Saugus Iron Works National Historic Site
review_text:
Very interesting historical site! The first integrated iron works in America, though it only operated for a few decades. The buildings have been restored, so you can walk through the furnace, forge, and slitting mill buildings and see what it would have looked like. They have examples of some of the intermediate products in the forge. It's cool to see how a chunk of iron progresses to a nice smooth bar or tiny rod to be made into nails.
The museum is small but very informative about the process of making iron and some of the history of the site.
Rangers give tours of the home on the site (restored home from late 1600's) and the iron works, but check the schedule to see what is available when, as it changes.

place_name: Saugus Iron Works National Historic Site
review_text: We stopped here on vacation so my daughters could earn their junior ranger badges. The site is well maintained and has a really cool museum in a building next to the visitors center. The museum had a video and lots of different artifacts and information about the Iron Works. They've even rebuilt parts of the original structure which was cool to walk through. There is a parking lot with lots of spaces and a building next to the visitors center with bathrooms that were clean and in good shape. The coolest part for my girls was the penny press machine in the visitor center that was completely free to use...you just need a penny. Great site!

place_name: Saugus Iron Works National Historic Site
review_text: Very interesting historical site.  I liked learning about how making iron tools first came to this country. Had no idea how they were made until visiting.  The buildings are only open from June through October.  I wish it was open in May.  The grounds are nice to walk around on all year round.   You can see the blast furnace and the huge bellows that fired it anytime. It is free to all.

place_name: Saugus Iron Works National Historic Site
review_text: It's a great historic stop with an incredible amount of information on the iron works expertise brought here and the expansion from there.

place_name: Saugus Iron Works National Historic Site
review_text: Wonderful historical site with loads of original and historically accurate recreations of a  working iron works plant from the 1600s.  The free guided tour was very well done and loaded with information.  This is the site of the first successful iron works in the US and became a training ground for others that followed.  They produced so much for early americans, from nails to wrought iron.

place_name: Saugus Iron Works National Historic Site
review_text: I did not know the history of this first in the nation foundry and iron works.  The visitors center is small and the gift shop very small.  They only take cards for purchases, no cash.  Then went to the musume and watched the history of this place.  The musume has original artifacts from the 1951 dig.
So much fun! They even have playground for children! I really enjoyed it. They had various machines! I'm coming back anytime soon!

Gatcha in Saugus, MA, is a great spot for people who enjoy the fun that claw machines offer. They have a wide variety of plushies, and the atmosphere is lively and exciting. The staff is friendly and always ready to help. Perfect for a joyful outing with friends or family!

This place is perfect to spend an hour or 2 for toddlers! They can run around and get out all their energy on really cool play structures. More than being aesthetically pleasing though is the level of cleanliness.. definitely feel the standard here is higher than other kids playgrounds. And the claw machines have the cutest plushies.

Clean and family-friendly for all ages. The large play area comes in clutch for smaller kids and the games are great for older ones and adults. Highly recommend if you need a place to have safe fun. Shout out to Eric and the rest of the staff!

Our visit to Gatcha was one of the best amusement park experiences we have ever had for our daughter. Extremely, clean, organized and futuristic environment, with new toys that provide safety and fun for children and parents. With affordable prices I strongly recommend this new concept to anyone who is looking for fun, excitement and unforgettable moments in the family.
Super fun and cute place for the little ones to release their energies , we come here every weekend!!Then plushies in the claw machines are super cute too !

Being a parent of a child with intense niche interests can be difficult to find a place that encapsulates it all. Between having sensory immersion in an accessible indoor playground, there is multiple actually winnable claw machines, and plushies galore. If you have an anime loving child who wishes they could go to Tokyo and experience the "kawaii" And cozy life, this place is the dreamland. I'm beyond grateful to find it.
Such a great place to let my little one expend extra energy, especially when it's rainy outside. Play space is clean and the plushies are so adorable. There's also some benches for parents to sit.
The Creation & Learning Station Preschool is there. What a great place for children to learn and have fun.
Fun and energetic staff keep the kids busy.
Great to keep kids safe and occupied.
My family loves the way the program is run.
I love this spot!
Nice place

place_name: Saugus Family YMCA and Gymnastics Center
review_text: Awesome YMCA, gymnastics center is our families most used spot. Great classes for my 2-year old, OPEN Gym is fantastic for rainy days and cold winter days. Our daughter held her 2nd birthday party there as well which was so easy for us and wonderful for all the kids! Highly recommend!

place_name: Saugus Family YMCA and Gymnastics Center
review_text: Great instructors.  Variety of classes and times.  CHILD WATCH!!!!My daughter can take a swim class.   I can rest assured while she is at child watch she will have a good time while I get in a fitness class.  My husband enjoys the large fitness floors and 5ks.We all love the special family events!

place_name: Saugus Family YMCA and Gymnastics Center
review_text: $65 for a DAY PASS to use an outdoor pool even though I'm a YMCA member. Seems absurd

place_name: Saugus Family YMCA and Gymnastics Center
review_text: What is there not to like about it? I enjoy all the group exercises. From total body strength, TRX, and MashUps are fabulous. Yoga and Pilates are for me, and I compliment them with Barre and Zumba for the best day ever. Inspired, challenged, and guided by incredible instructors along with awesome members is an extension of my family. The only thing missing is Couch Potato Training.

place_name: Saugus Family YMCA and Gymnastics Center
review_text: There are a few positive things I will write about this establishment before I get into the real stuff. First, My son loved it here. He had friends here and enjoyed the things he got to do here. Second, was an employee there name Kyle. He was the only person would could handle an issue with professionalism and actually sincerity. Third, this place was convenient. Thats it. Now I went here has a child and loved it so sending my son there for Kindergarten and Summer camp had me feeling very nostalgic and sentimental. Two and a half years ago there were friendly staff and wonderful and it was very organized.  My son had the most amazing teacher Mrs. Sue and she was a dream. Over the last year and a half myself and many other parents had to deal with nasty attitudes, disorganized leadership, lack of communication and many other frustrations. I will never step foot into this establishment ever again. From the ways the After school director spoke to the children so negatively to how issues were handled by upper management. I have to say that taking my son out of here has to be the best choice I have made for him and myself.

place_name: Saugus Family YMCA and Gymnastics Center
review_text: The staff here is INCREDIBLY friendly. I just took a tour of several YMCA facilities around the northern suburbs of Boston to find the right fit, and chose Saugus above the others. It is a nice, newer, clean facility with plenty of space to work out, and tons of parking. Because there aren't large crowds, there is virtually no wait times for exercise equipment, which is nice, because I can then go at my own pace. Isaac and Ashley at the front desk were wonderful and made me feel quite welcome. Would highly recommend this Y facility to anyone in the area who's looking for a gym!

place_name: Saugus Family YMCA and Gymnastics Center
review_text: My daughter had the most horrific experience here. Sending her to their childcare center is the worst decision I have ever made. My daughter struggles with anxiety and whenever she would get upset her teacher would call the director to remove her from the classroom rather than trying to assist her with emotional regulation skills which early childhood educators are supposed to know how to do. The director would then call me to pick my daughter up from school. This went on for months. Then they changed her classroom. The next teacher was a bit better but again the teachers & administration have absolutely no training or skills in assisting children with emotional regulation. They didn't  even try to come up with an action plan to assist her. I had to reach out to outside resources to give them suggestions on how to help her. Eventually they didn't want to help my daughter at all & decided they didn't want to deal with her so they kicked her out of the program. These people lack training and compassion for children who just need a little extra help and understanding. When I had a meeting with them they were more interested in talking about setting up their patio furniture for spring than they were in helping my daughter. A complete disgrace. If I could rate them with zero stars I would.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Krystal,  We appreciate you taking the time to meet with the Saugus YMCA Child Care Team. We appreciate the productive discussion and wish you the best of luck.

place_name: Saugus Family YMCA and Gymnastics Center
review_text: My son went to this daycare years ago and still talks about it to this day! The staff is amazing and i cannot wait for my daughter to be old enough to attend! The staff always had suggestions for how to help him, he is a VERY active boy and needs 1 on 1 attention at times. My niece and nephew currently attend. They came from a daycare that wasn't so put together. I cannot begin to explain the live they now have for school and how far they have come!

Crazy busy during February vacation but the two staff members worked their butts off to keep everyone happy! There was a great selection of pieces and variety of price range. We were very happy with the finished projects!

Friends' daughters birthday was here today. 2 employees working a party for 21 kids and however many other people were coming in.

Packed all 21 kids on 1 table, and it really should have been 2... but apparently, the 2nd table was for food only?

Could have been a much better experience.

We looked up times on the website which specifically stated that they were open until 6 pm for February vacation on Saturday and Sunday. Our 6 year old was very dissapointed to walk in seeing other kids painting and being told it was closed at only 5:20.

My opinion: I went for a recent outing for my nieces 6th birthday and from what I personally saw the employees were on their phone and not paying attention at all. Unpleasant attitudes and unhelpful. If you care about reviews look at how the owners respond to these comments. If the owners don't like bad reviews then maybe they should fix their establishment.

Beware! It seems like any bad review they receive they try to discredit/disregard the negative comments by claiming it's a fake account, former angry employee or not their establishment. The owners need some accountability and I'm not seeing any of that in any of these comments. As a business, you rely on customers to keep your business going. How do you own a business and can't take constructive criticism.

Ps. Owners of plaster fun time, let me save you the trouble of trying to discredit my poor review. I'm a real customer, not a former employee or a fake account and I CERTAINLY ENTERED THE SAUGUS LOCATION right in the plaza where fuddruckers used to be (just if in case someone replies that it wasn't their establishment) and all my previous 4 reviews are positive (since the owners like to go into profiles and investigate previous reviews, further not taking accountability of their store and employees).As stated previously this is my opinion.

Last month I had my daughter's birthday party at the Saugus location. It was a horrible experience. 1) I did not get half of what was advertised and I paid 100s of dollars for. No special gift for the bday girl, no hats, no paper products, no hostess! Nothing that made my girl feel special or help me out while I entertained all the kids myself. I showed up as instructed 10 minutes before the party and they had no idea I was coming or prepared for the party. The worst part is I made multiple voicemails to the manager, went into the store and sent emails with no response back. Horrible experience! Don't waste your money here! pick a different place that actually cares and doesn't rip you off.
response_from_owner_text: Factually incorrect and we are taking legal action against this continued and baseless harassment.

review_text: I'm so sad, they changed so much about this place from since I was a kid going to birthday parties. I always want to get the really big sculptures that costed up to 50$ - 70$ each. I waited so long to finally be able to buy these big sculptures myself. And they don't have them any more, even when I was a kid I would get the 30$ sculptures which were still bigger than the sculptures they have now. (They also don't have these anymore either)  This was the only place you could get really nice animal sculptures that big that you could paint yourself. This place used to be somewhere parents can also enjoy along with their kid, but it's turned into a place really only catered to 5-10 year old children and their birthday parties.
response_from_owner_text:
The name of our store since 1995 "is where kids do it their way". You are complaining that we cater to kids.. and have LOWER prices than your faulty memory suggests???? Seriously?
This is not a real review. Fake google profile with one review. Hmm.....

review_text: We just hosted our son's 6th birthday here and they could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Everyone had a great time and the staff were attentive, helpful and friendly. Victoria took the lead on helping out our group and she was amazing - the patience and diplomacy she exercised with that group of TWELVE 6-year-olds was beyond what anyone could hope to expect. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun birthday spot or just an afternoon hang with the kiddos.

Provides all the  needed materials w no time limit ( if u dont finish by the time they close they even let u come back next day for free).
Decent amount of choices. Nice bright colors with choices for shiney,  plain, or sparkling finish at the end.

Roller World is a must try if you like skating. Tuesdays and Fridays are 18 and over. The entrance is $10. The rink is huuuuge, and there is a smaller one for beginners. If you have kids, they do birthday parties. They open from noon to 9 pm on Saturdays, and they serve pizza . This place is a ton of fun for all ages!!
LOVE THIS PLACE! I had my 10th birthday party here and it was extremely fun! I recommend you have your birthday party here.

Everything was easy, peasy, but the food is complete Garbage it's burned hard, wouldn't even give my dog. This is a children's place. Why is this pizza not soft or any of the food correctly cooked the Fries alone are literally hard but yet soggy and only cold

Had my kids birthday party. The place has a nice and good fun vibe.

The place was over crowded. It seemed like they had too many birthday parties allowed at the same time and plus the people coming in to skate by tickets.

It is a good place to go spend some time skating and having fun. But for a birthday party I would not recommend this place. Their party room was small people standing outside the room and they serve pizza in one side of the room and cake in a diferent room, and no space for people to walk. No help to serve pizza and drinks.

I would not recommend it for kids birthday party.

We went to Roller works at a birthday party. The place has a nice and good fun vibe.

The place was over crowded. It seemed like they had too many birthday parties allowed at the same time and plus the people coming in to skate by tickets.

It is a good place to go spend some time skating and having fun. But for a birthday party I would not recommend this place. Their party room was small and packed with so many people with different parties at the same time, and no space for people to walk. Their pizza was terrible.

In short it's good for some fun if the place is not over crowded, and I would not recommend it for a birthday party.

The rink is very large and in good shape, nice music and lighting
They have a second small rink area for beginners as well
They host events for birthdays and kids
There's arcade games as well and a good stand
You can also purchase skates and wheels there

I visited for the first time on March 12, 2024, it was for adult night. I must say, I was impressed with the facility when I walked in. It has that nostalgic "old school" roller skating rink smell, that everyone who stepped into one during the prime of roller skating in the 1980s and 1990s. The staff were all friendly, they search your belongings when you walk in (I think that is added piece of mind) that someone won't get stabbed or capped on the rink or even in the building. The music is plenty loud, enough to get those feet moving and a groove started. The song selection was great too. They play a mix of everything. The floor is nice, it has a nice feel when you're rolling. It's wood, the best kind of skate floor you can be on. They even have a JR rink off to the side, where you can go work on technique or even get your skate legs. I am not giving it a complete 5 star, because I think they can do better with organizing the rink a little better. I am an experienced skater and a couple of times; I thought I was going to be run over and killed by a some of them who are just skating recklessly. And then others who are doing tricks in the travel area, which jams up the ability to spread out. Not everyone wants to speed skate. I frequent other area rinks and they set the rink up for all ability levels and all speed levels. And if you are flying around the rink, you get a warning and told to "slow down" and then anything subsequent, the consequences get a little stiffer. Just a little food for thought. I otherwise love this place and you have gained a regular patron. I do recommend anyone reading this, to give it a try. I think you will like it. I loved it. It is a great place. It is one of the senior skating rinks, in the area, having opened in 1981 and 43 years later is still doing something right. Thank you, Roller World. I'll be in on adult night, from here forward. Great job to all the staff for being so organized, as far as checking in and getting situated goes.
Great place but the rentals are in pretty bad shape.  Overall it was a fun time.

The parking was a bit tricky but it's in Kelly's  back lot. There are a few spots reserved to access the trails. The trails are mainly for mountain bikes. The hike overall is rocky, up a steep hill, a bit challenging. Not for baby strollers or for those not in modest physical shape. The views were great, but the trails are not clearly marked, so be warned. Boots are a must for this hike if you don't have a bike. It's an adventure to be out, to check this spot out.

Easy hike.The amount of work the bike riders have put into the trails is noteworthy in itself. Fun hike for the kids, lots of twists and turns, all going the same basic way. Would want to be a bit watchful in bike season. The cliff is great! I remember living nearby and hearing stories of it.  Fun spot, great views, fun hike. If you're looking for a quick, interesting hike-maybe while you're getting a oil change-or a quick woodsy diversion, this is a great spot.
Short but strenuous hike along dirt bike trails. Sad that people leave so much trash here and some have added tasteless things to a really cool unique artwork.

This is an amazing spot for Mountain Biking! Amazing views and challenging terrain. That being said, most of the trails here are difficult and none of them are well marked. Many places are advertised as being difficult and a tough challenge but these trails mean it. If you are not an experienced rider or are not in good physical condition DO NOT venture far off the main trail and if you do, make SURE whatever you go down you will be able to go back the same way you came.

Ride safe,
- CM

Kindoff a cool spot! Kids like it.
Easy walk from Rt 1.
Nice views of Boston from the trails.
Parking is at the back of the car dealership, there's a couple of spots for skull cliff.

I wanted to see this cliff before the vandals destroyed it but unfortunately it's pretty much destroyed. It was a quick slightly steep hike up to the old quarry, and the mountain bike group has kept the trails in good shape. I hiked from the parking lot behind a jeep dealership with my dog( the only glass I found was around the edges/ledges of the quarry.)

This place is a bit tough to find. Google maps will get you close but no parking. You need to park in the designated area behind the Chystler dealership. They ha e it marked and even provide a lil picnic area. Hike up and through the downhill mountain bike trails and you will find this masterpiece of spray paint. .

Staff is super helpful, there are lots of activities Mon-Friday, the location is bright and clean. They offer sing-alongs, bingo, knitting and other activities... there is even a gym with rowing machines and treadmills.

The Saugus Senior center is a fabulous place with lots of friendly senior people & a very wonderful staff! They offer lots of activities daily as well as lunch. There is informative talks, events, trips, lots of classes like chair yoga & line dancing, art, kareoke, singing, card games, puzzles, large print books & a gift store. I would recommend this center to any senior. I just joined late last Fall & I love going there. I brought my 84 y.o. girl friend of 35 years as a guest about a week ago & she loved it there also.
I love this place. The staff is very friendly. There's something for all seniors. Chair Yoga, line dancing, cards, bingo, and so much more. Come and enjoy.
My friend took me to lunch there. They have all kinds of activities for seniors. Plus a nice gift shop and books you can get for very little money.

The Senior Center has been closed since  March.  Our singing group has been meeting in the parking lot to sing together and keep ourselves sane.  We sit 6 feet apart and we are wearing masks.  It's great.
Visited on Saturday for child ID and staff was excellent directing us to the proper area. My grandson enjoyed himself on the trucks and machines in the parking lot.

My first experience  was so enjoying. The best part of the visit was knowing that. They are from saugus. Residents still living there that I went to school with in the 1960s . It made me feel like I was home again. I love saugus. Massachusetts  I lived there from 1964 -dec 1971 ..my best years. I was a child  .
Wonderful environment, but click's exist which is sad at seniors ages.

The level of customer service here is amazing, the classes they offer are amazing, and it is generally a great organization. I took intro to camping 102 and Mountaineering 101 and 102, and it was an excellent combination of lecture, group discussion, and hands on practice. If this is what every class had been like in school, I'd have been an A student, and have a much deeper understanding of how the world works.
response_from_owner_text: Michael, So kind of you. Hopefully you can find time to make it out again. - Eliot

review_text: The curriculum was thought out and expertly delivered.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Jim!

review_text: The Wilmington location is small but mighty. Bright lights, great music, amazing equipment, cheap monthly payment, clean, and always someone at the front desk 24hrs. It was a no brainer for me when I found this gym. There are no gyms around here this good. I would recommend this place to anyone that is serious about there lifting.

Best gym in the country!! I've been to gyms in NY, Miami, LA and nothing compares. Ultraflex is the best gym I have ever been to. This gym is the reason I can't leave MA. They have a sauna, posing room, separate room dedicated to legs, every chest, shoulder, and back machine you can think of & it's two levels. The dumbbells go up extremely high as well. If you're in the area I 11/10 recommend you check it out & grab some merch while you're there!
response_from_owner_text: Greatly appreciated!

review_text: Great gym, friendly staff. Cleanest gym I have ever been too with every equipment you need. Parking is never a problem either. Budget friendly. You're making a mistake by not signing up.

This gym has everything you need and look for into bodybuilding. The equipment and facility speaks for itself. I recommend it because it's not too expensive and they also give discounts to nurses and certain jobs

Emilio is a great employee as well

Just MASSIVE! It's bigger than a football field, filled with all new equipment.  Great design/atmosphere, plenty of parking, clean bathrooms, and all the weight you could possibly lift.  It was a really open environment and they had a lot of cardio and weight lifting pieces of equipment you don't see most places.  Worth a day pass but be warned, you'll probably buy a membership.
response_from_owner_text: Appreciated

review_text: Love this gym. Only gripe is I wish it was open until 11 or a 24 hour location as well. Hate going to Planet Fitness after hours and Wilmington isn't convenient being that I stay in the area and go after work.

This is the best gym I've ever been to! Top line equipments, sauna, clean, upbeat music, energy and environment! Great management and members! It feels like a tribe of likeminded people working towards achieving the same goal! And that is a fit, healthy and STRONG body and mind as a LIFESTYLE! Watching everyone working out is truly inspiring! For those who are SERIOUS about their workout regimen should definitely come here! I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the great review

review_text: This fitness facility has profoundly impacted my well being. The state of the art equipment and excellent saunas contribute to a friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Overall, I rate it 5 stars for its exceptional qualities.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks

review_text:
I've been going to F45 for couple of months and it's been awesome! The instructors are great, always helping us get the most out of the workouts and correcting forms as needed.
Thanks to the diversity of workouts and exercices, this is the only studio I've stuck with, and I've been telling all my friends about it. They love it too!

Absolutely loved joining F45 Saugus! The coaches were amazing. They cater to all fitness levels and the coaches actually help you with form and technique. Very positive, nonjudgmental environment. I had to move out of state for work, but my experience at F45 Saugus was amazing and I'll miss the classes and coaches greatly. If you're hesitant about stopping by for a class, just do it! You won't be disappointed.

All the coaches at this f45 are so friendly and helpful and inspiring! I love working out here, particularly the weight classes. Fernanda is always pushing me to lift heavier, which I would never have done without her encouragement. Charlotte has helped correct my form.  Brenda and Mijia are the ultimate cheer squad. And if you check out the early morning classes Gracie, Gabbie and Sonny are the ultimate wake up coaches for when you're half asleep! You can purchase class packs if a full membership isn't for you and use them for just the type of class you like or to train exclusively with one of the above coaches!

I really like this location and their wonderful staff! I don't know how they do it sometimes when they have big classes but they make sure everyone is doing the exercise correctly, for me that was one of the main plus in a gym to make sure the coaches guide you thru. Love the judgement free zone and the vibe it always makes you wanna come back for more. Big cheers for two of my coaches Maija and Brenda LOVE LOVE the vibes from you ladies, always helping us to push forward. I highly recommend this location in Saugus. If you are looking to stay healthy and vibe with awesome people don't hesitate to stop by!!!

Started F45 about 3 months ago. Beyond thrilled with the instructors and my improvement/results! Gym is always very clean, and classes are super engaging. Would highly recommend for anyone considering trying!!

I love the energy, the trainings, the community.
One year ago I could never imagine I would even go to the gym, let alone enjoy it.
I really love the place and I don't a miss a chance to talk about it to all my friends.

Amazing first class with coach Gabby and Fernanda!
Gabby was so bubbly& motivating, she really kept me pushing through and this is coming from a newbie to fitness! Definitely recommend. Will for sure be back !

Started a trial at F45 and let me say this gym is crazy! All instructors are very friendly and welcoming. All exercises were demonstrated well, and I was able to get help on my form when needed! So far, I've enjoyed this gym and its group environment. I believe it's kept me motivated and the instructors push you to do your best as well!! 10/10 would recommend to anyone looking to get in a good workout in short time!!
Very well maintained baseball field
Fun place to watch kids' games, plenty of seating. Mediocre snack bar, but they had stuff, and reasonably priced. Great place to watch a sponsored league summer game
Nice field. Has bathrooms. Snack shack actually open and cheap. What else do you want?
Beautiful park, clean and the guys in the snack shack are awesome!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your support and kind words!

review_text: Great, even though we lost.
Beautiful field, excellent staff
Well kept
You csn good baseball
I love OTF! All the coaches and staff are the best and make working out so fun and easy. I love the intensity of the workouts and I am seeing real results. Highly recommend!!
Absolutely love it here! Great studio and even better instructors. So much fun and consistency really does bring great results with this HIIT workout!

Great studio, coaches, and staff! Everyone is very friendly and welcoming. The workout is truly for all abilities and fitness types and the coaches will adapt and modify anything that you need. Been a member for 4 years and just hit my 1000th class and looking forward to 1000th more!

Orange Theory Fitness is amazing! I love the coaches and the staff and the workouts.  In my first year, I was able to finally run a mile without stopping!  I've increased my weight levels on the weight floor and I'm still having a love-hate relationship with the rower.  I feel like I've accomplished something when I finish an OTF workout and the coaches are just amazing people! They are motivating, supportive, encouraging, fun, personable and just great people!  The staff is also friendly and fantastic. There's this strange need/desire to push yourself more and more with each workout and I feel like I'm getting results - I feel stronger, fitter, and healthier than ever!

Had an amazing first class! I'm a newbie, and just getting back into fitness in general. But Laura gave us such good information and made us feel so welcome, and Nicole was a fantastic coach! I survived my first class, and so inspired to come back again! The music is stellar, the hour-long class actually flew by.

Amazing workouts, encouraging trainers, and great people. I recommend to anyone interested in starting a workout routine and meeting new people. There are new challenges, team activities, and gym events that keep you interested in working out and show progress. Love it here!

I Love OrangeTheory Saugus. The workouts are different every time I go, the coaches are patient and make the classes fun. They always show us alternative moves and work with us to challenge and motivate us. The FOMO is real when I can't get at least 3 classes in a week.
always a great workout, I am always so happy I went to a class and all the staff and coaches are super encouraging and make you want to be there. Go OTF!

What a great experience at Title boxing gym.  Had a class on Saturday and it's been awhile since I have worked out and I was a little nervous.  The class went by so fast and before I knew it I had a fantastic, fun workout and learned a ton.  Great time!!!

recommend & excellent title boxing classes -  staff and instructors are very enthusiastic and eager to help. Club and it's staff truly go out of there way to make a member feel welcome and valued. Club has motivational energy.

Super fun, the staff and owner are super involved and accessible. Love the place and accommodations.
Exercise wise, I enjoy every minute of it. I have missed feeling so active and pushing myself.

Took the 4:30 class on Wednesday and wow it was awesome!!! Kyle was the instructor and he was great I'm new to title boxing and was a bit intimidated using a bag but Kyle explained everything great and gave an incredible workout.  I'll be sore tomorrow.  I highly recommend the class on Wednesday at 4:30 especially if your new to kickboxing.  Everyone was super friendly and helpful I'll be back again soon

My trainers, Cordula and Cate, are encouraging and patient. I enjoy their classes along with Roger and his Wednesday class. I have learned so much about boxing but also learned to believe in myself. I just had my first training session in the ring with Cordula this past Sunday. It was fabulous I can't wait to go back

So far I'm enjoying my boxing classes with a friendly and knowledgeable trainers.
I highly recommend this club to anyone who's trying to shape up and learn very useful set of boxing techniques.

Thanks to Title boxing club Saugus team for being kind and helpful.

Title Boxing is the absolute best fitness center that I have ever been a member of. The workouts are fun, engaging, yet very challenging. The instructors are personable, motivating, and create a friendly atmosphere. Since joining Title I have been challenged in every area of my life to exceed beyond my own limitations. I'm excited to be a part of this club, and plan to be well into the future.

Just had my first class back after a brief hiatus from summer travels. Grace did a great job leading us through the rounds with clear and easy to follow combos. Her emphasis on proper form also helped me to shake the rust off and get back into the groove. I'm definitely looking forward to the next class!

I took my husband to celebrate his birthday and we had a wonderful time! The food was great, the comedians were very funny and our server, Fiona was an absolute doll! Tickets to shows are $20. We enjoyed ourselves!

I've lived on the N Shore for 25 yrs....How was last night my FIRST NIGHT at Giggles...? Crazy.
Solid comedy line-up, Jimmy Cash (the Janitor) was the table favorite. Pharmacist a close 2nd (for some reason, his audio was just a little soft, we unfortunately missed a few tid-bits).
Food: Delicious, Lasagna is memorable.
Service: We got there at 7 (recommended), service was exceptional.
Note: Drinks, Apps, Salads, Entrees, Desserts. $110 per couple (including tip) is ab 1/2 of what we would have spent in Nbpt).
We had a fantastic night al'round; a total blast AND we'll be back.

Food was just so so.   Pizza was so salty we didn't eat a second slice.  Table by window was freezing due to no insulation and old single pane glass Had to wear jacket inside to stay  warm    Staff were nice.    Parking was plenty but needed more outdoor lighting.      Great location but needs makeover including food.
My fiance and myself really enjoyed the comedy. The food was good, the entertainment got us in the door though
Awesome comedians. Great food and service. Def try the toasted raviolis

Great time
First time, just be aware you will be setting with other people at a table that's for 4.  Which I'm ok with.

Christine Hurley was outstanding! She was expressive, engaging and kept the audience laughing her entire performance.  She deserves 5
Lenny Clark appeared less than thrilled to be performing which reflected in his tired act.  2
Pizzas were good as usual and came out as expected but it took 45 minutes for a salad  and 30 minutes for a drink.
Great place to catch a comedy show! Easy parking and great pizza in this intimate comedy venue.

Great location! Drive up here from the South Shore to pick up Agricola. They were nice enough to hold the game for me for a couple days! When I arrived they helped me locate an expansion as well! It was a popular store with lots of people playing games in the back. That was nice to see. It's also in a very convenient location on Route 1.
I went for my first Friday Night Magic, and the community and staff were welcoming and friendly, especially to a new player! I will definitely be returning.

Good space to play games at fair prices. Despite not being operated by the owner like other more homey card shops, you are still treated really nice by the employees here. Tournaments can be rough with some unoriginal people playing the same best 2 decks in the meta, but still some cool and nice people come here as well so it evens out..

Excellent place for board games, Magic the Gathering, Yu-Gi-Oh, and more. I've been to a Yu-Gi-Oh event and plan to go for Magic "FNM" soon. Check their website for the event schedule. I had some single cards shipped from their Abington location for pick up here and the price and convenience was great! Friendly staff.

Met a friend to play some games at this location.  They have a large selections of games to purchase, and plenty of room to play for those that want to play in the store.  There are lots of events and scheduled play days where you can come and meet other people that also play the same games you like.

They have food and drinks you can purchase to help make your gaming more enjoyable .  This location is also easy to get too.

its a great community shop to play with others and they have a huge variety of items, but the pokemon product is just way too expensive compared to market price. i can buy my stuff cheaper online or somewhere else.
Great store with great employees. They have a huge selection of games and tabletop models for games like Wathammer and Warmachine, Starwars, D&D and many more. If you're in the area check it out!

Awesome Game Shop
Large play area with events!

Great selection of all Tabletop options including Miniatures, RPG and Board games

great place for family walking. Stroller friendly.
2 playgrounds. beach. squirrels and other small animals.
It's a beautiful relaxing family area. People are pleasant. 2 parks for kids to play. Dog friendly. A pond with life guards.  Has a lot of growth in the pond. Loved walking.
Beautiful walk in nature
Great place for the whole family.

Parfait pour une balade
En mode preparation NYCM 2022, l'endroit est ideal pour s'entrainer.
Deux entrees pour acceder au parc, routes et chemins balises...impossible de se perdre !
Promeneurs et sportifs se cotoient, pour une belle balade c'est ici qu'il faut venir.
review_translated_text:
Perfect for a stroll
In NYCM 2022 preparation mode, the place is ideal for training.
Two entrances to access the park, marked roads and paths...impossible to get lost!
Walkers and sportsmen rub shoulders, for a beautiful walk this is the place to come.

review_text: Yo camino en este lugar
Finally getting better. They have one rink done. No more cement wall, way safer for the kiddos. Still a dungeon.
VERY OLD AND DIRTY .  The lobby was last updated in 1979 .  THE ICE IS WORST THAN SANDPAPER.   POND HOCKEY WOULD BE BETTER !
Very weird place people can't see though the glass because f the puck marks, very old and dirty rink. But they are going to replace the glass and etc this year so that is on the plus side.

The rink is in poor condition. Plumbing fixtures in the men's room are loose and broken. The rink smells like exhaust and is frequently evacuated due to high levels of carbon monoxide (causing cancelled games). The one zamboni they have for the two sheets frequently breaks down (causing more cancelled games). The north rink doesn't have glass along one side; the boards slope up to the CMU wall. Humidity levels are a frequent issue and the glass fogs up making it impossible to watch games (possibly due to doors that don't fully close). Even when the glass isn't fogged up, it's so scratched visibility is still poor.

But, they have a nice, freshly paved and painted parking lot!

This rink is a dump. The locker rooms are always filthy. They have to shut it down due to carbon monoxide. The boards are falling apart. There's a cinder block wall instead of glass on both rinks.

It's a disgrace this place even has a certificate of occupancy.

Hockeytown barely edges out Zapusta in Randolph as the worst rink in Eastern Mass. It's outdated, antiquated, and in disrepair (at no fault of the on-site staff, they do their best but the systems and infrastructure are failing). The ownership (we all know who they are) needs to bite the bullet and do what need to be done.

Fun place for all ages.
Hockey games or stick practice.
Great location.
A MA landmark and has helped generations of skaters! One request, Please , please give it a facelift , and fix those peculiar back wall boards , never seen rink with no glass on one side??

What truly sets CrossFit Route 1 apart is the sense of community that pervades every aspect of the gym. From the friendly and welcoming atmosphere to the regular social events and friendly competitions, CrossFit Route 1 feels like a second home. I have made close friends here, and I look forward to every workout because I know I'll be surrounded by people who genuinely care about my progress and wellbeing.

The most impressive thing about CrossFit Route 1 is the way they manage to make every workout both challenging and fun. Sure, the workouts can be tough, but the coaches and members make sure to inject plenty of humor and positivity into every class. It's not unusual to hear laughter and cheers during even the most grueling workouts, and that kind of energy is infectious.

So if you're looking for a gym that's more than just a place to exercise, but a true community that will support you every step of the way, look no further than CrossFit Route 1. I can't recommend this place enough, and I know you'll love it as much as I do.

CrossFit Route 1 is the perfect blend of fitness, fun, and community. I'm proud to be a member of this amazing gym.

I joined CF Route 1 January 2019 because I was bored of my regular routine at LA Fitness type gyms. On the recommendation of a good friend I took the prep courses even though I considered myself an experienced gym goer. Humbled but excited is an understatement after the first few days. Literally every day was something new and that's what made it so exciting and fun. I found myself anxiously waiting to see what the next workout was and then immediately looking at ways to improve on skills that I had just learned. The coaches also make EVERY single person able to feel comfortable in their abilities at the gym. In any given class you would find athletes from every fitness level and skill level, young to old, male to female etc. Not only is everyone welcome, but they make it welcoming for everyone. And if you come, put in the work, and also have fun, the results will be noticed in both body and mind.

All fitness aside, it's the community of CrossFit Route 1 that really kept me coming back. I can 100% say that I've made lifelong friends met people who truly care about how I am as a person. The most fun that I've had at CF Route 1 has been cheering on my friends, or different events when I wasn't even working out. I had been going to CrossFit Route 1 for 4 years before I reluctantly had to switch because I have moved. But even though I'm not technically a member, the coaches and athletes, who are now friends still check in on me and we have maintained our friendship. I still come back and pop in with my daughter just to hang out when we can.

Jared and Tracy have done a great job creating a very fun and welcoming environment and community that focuses on getting EVERYONE better. CrossFit route 1 will improve you no question.

I can't compare CrossFit Route 1 to other CrossFit gyms, because I joined 11 years ago and have never left! It's my happy place, where for an hour a day a few times a week, I can focus on my mental and physical health. Jared and Tracy have built the most beautiful community. The coaches are knowledgeable and supportive and the programming will help you meet your fitness goals, whatever they are. Come join us!

I started at Crossfit Route 1 three and a half years ago at a complete physical low point. I was trying hard to find the right place to work movement back into my life but was struggling to find a welcoming and encouraging place that provided the right instruction to do it without destroying myself in the process. This gym was recommended to and I figured it was worth a shot.
I was not sure when I started if this was the right place for me. I was uncomfortable with how friendly and supportive everyone was. It felt weird that strangers wanted to know my name and were willing to help me adjust to the workouts. But after a month, I knew this was the community for me. I've never been around a group of adults who are so committed to each others health and well being. Surrounding myself with these type of positive people has been incredibly special and not something everyone has in their daily lives. So much so that even on my worst day getting to the gym is the highlight.
The diversity of the people working out at the gym is special and the coaches give personal focus during class time to help each of us meet our goals. The coaches are incredibly knowledgeable on how to make small adjustments to your lifestyle to fit the goal of living a healthy life with advice on diet, exercises, how hard to push yourself and how to do it safely. Most importantly, they all want you to know how to build your whole body into something that you can use to enjoy daily activities and even to do some things that might have seemed impossible.
Jared and Tracy have built something very special. He has a place where people work hard, have fun doing it, and support each other along the way. He has great coaches who are some of the most special people I have ever met and  help make this gym a place where members are comfortable taking risks and support each other.
I can't say enough great things about this gym and the incredible people who I met there.

The best hour of my day! Been to a few other Crossfit gyms but Route1 has been the best one yet!
I made the most amazing friends!
Tracy and Jared thank you  for everything you do on a daily basis for us!

I stepped into cfrt1 almost 10 years ago, out of shape and nervous, but knowing I needed to make a change for a healthier life. I was welcomed with open arms by the coaches and the other members. I have learned how powerful being a (physically) strong woman is, how invigorating giving your all to a workout is, and how important a strong community is. The coaches and Jared and Tracy are professional and inspiring, they have pushed me to be stronger and fitter, and helped me through injury. The members are truly like family, and some of my closest friendships have developed out of this amazing gym. It is more than just CrossFit. It's Community.

A great place to work out while having fun! I started Crossfit here back in August 2019. Always hated every type of gym work out... now I hit this place 4-5 times a week early in the morning and love every minute of it. All the coaches are VERY knowledgeable and will help you through every class, no matter what your skill level is. The environment is very welcoming for everyone. If you are considering starting working out (or just looking for a new place to go to) this is the place to go!

CrossFit Route 1:

My wife has been a member for two years and finally convinced me to join. After almost 2 years of having shoulder surgery I was nervous about how my body would react. My sports doctor approved me to workout. After almost 3 months I can say I'm so happy with the results. My shoulder mobility and strength has improved so much. Physical therapy helped me a lot but CrossFit made my shoulder stronger than ever. The owner and his wife and the other coaches are great! They personalize the training to your level. The people attending are very nice and encouraging. Thank you CrossFit Route 1 for helping get stronger and improving my overall health. I appreciate you guys!
Nice place to visit. It's quite an interesting place, quite at the moment of visit. The park has a soccer complex, a basketball  court, a children's playground, and many more.
Well maintained and loved soccer & baseball fields!

The park was nice, it was a nice day out, not too many people were at the park. They had swings and slides that was the main things they had, and also monkey bars. Other than that a few broken things at the park that need to be fixed , this park is small nice and quiet, they built a new fancy park very close that alot of people go too.
Great place to with the kids. It has four swings. Two regular and two for small children. Great slide monkey bars a baseball field a  soccer field and basketball courts. Great place for families

Should be named Anna Parker Dangerous over-Crowded Parking Lot & soccer fields.

Where should I start...hmmm maybe the Old beat up, broken & dangerous playground equipment, how about the bees from the trash/litter spread throughout the dried up & sparse mulched ground that was probably laid 4 +years ago, or the broken & unsafe wood beams that act as barriers around the play space perimeter...that give you deep splinters if touched, an accident waiting to happen.
The wooden beam is not going to help keep small children contained & there is about five  feet btw the slide & VERY busy parking lot!

Not to mention the opening of the park is so close to the parking lot where cars are making the turn to find a space. Numerous times I've witnessed (& had a panic attack) watching cars come bombing thru & a child nearly get run over by a vehicle.  Mostly SUVs. So SCARY!

Saugus!  Come on!  Please spend some of that rainy day fund you are all bragging about recently. Sadly Anna Parker is Saugus' BEST playground. How sad is that?!  Our children deserve better.  Please stop throwing millions into more Senior Citizen housing complex on every block & focus on keeping young families living here by funding Kindergarten & play spaces. Our children are OUR future.  They will appreciate us if we stop neglecting their needs while growing up in his Town.  This is terrible. Rant over....
I guess it's a cool playground if you are your no or looking for a relaxing place depending of course. I just happen to go there because it contains 2 PokeStops and one Gym :)
Slides had inappropriate graffiti and things were a little run down here. The swings were fun for the kids.
Really nice playground, lots of space for kids to play. Needs some work done in some places, but overall it's good.

This facility is dangerous. The clientele make no effort to return equipment and the staff make no effort to enforce the contract that each member signed. Stay away unless you are not risk adverse. No hot water and one functioning water fountain.

LA Fitness is not supper close to my residence but it is the nearest that has pool. They, also, ran a special $29 a month  with $49 annual fee. Can't talk about other locations. Saugus MA location is pretty spacious facility. However, it needs serios renovation and cleaning ASAP. I am surprised that health department allows them to be open to public. Filthy shower rooms don't gave any handles to bend to pick up your shampoo since there is no place but the dirty floors covered with hair. Shower curtains are covered with mold, dirt and sticky. Everyone is showering without closing to a paid major bacteria or infection desease. Pool water is murky after hours. Employees are either tired or have no drive to be there. Front desk guy was half sleep on one of the chairs outside of customer service area. I would never guessed that he works there if shirt did t have their logo.

What a great experience! Jennifer the general manager was extremely kind and knowledgeable. I went to inquire about memberships and felt welcomed immediately. Jennifer and the staff were extremely kind. Aside from the impressive facility, the gym stood out to me particularly for the upbeat and respectful environment. Highly recommend and excited to return!

They have a range of equipment but it's not well taken care of, maintained regularly or installed properly. I'll list only SOME of the issues below:

*Decline bench is off on one side making it easier to injure your shoulders if you aren't careful and are mindful to readjust. It shouldn't be a requirement to remember that a bench is improperly installed before a lift especially since it's been like this for at least two years now.

*They do not have enough barbells for the weight training area/turf which is where a lot of people take them to and don't bring them back.

*unlike other gyms they don't have a person to re rack peoples weights and pick things up throughout the day. They also do not actually enforce any of their roles to encourage people to pick up after themselves.

*The jacuzzi has been broken or "closed for maintenance" the majority of days that I have shown up to the gym versus actually functional.

*Handicap spots are not respected and if a person is blocking access, nothing is done about it.

*There are no buttons to open any of the doors making it hard or impossible for those with limited mobility to come to the gym and try and better themselves.

*The chair that is supposed to help disabled people get into the pool has been broken for god knows how long and nothing has been done to actually make it functional and operational.

*the handicap bathrooms, shower stall and handicapped area of machines is not respected and gets taken up by people all the time and no one questions it unless someone goes to the desk and complains.

*The pool was a huge reason for me joining this gym and I now cannot and have not been able to use it for atleast 4 months now due to the chair being broken and being offered no other options other than to wait for "batteries to come in".

I shouldn't have to consistently and constantly be asking for accessibility. I should be able to walk in and use the gym that I am PAYING FOR to its fullest extent.

This gym could truly be accessible and be great in the way that they claim to strive to be but are falling short.

I am posting this review in hopes that it may make a higher up pay attention to their rating and force them to care about the issues especially since they have the time to make prices higher and higher for new people coming in while fixing none of the major issues.

Update: the gym is worse than a year ago when I wrote this review. Gross and unsafe. None of the issues I listed in this review or that I've reported have been fixed. New ones have popped up and more and more equipment keeps failing. They've also now started to shut off the lights inside of the gym the last few months even while they're open to make people leave. I understand not wanting people to linger at the end of your shift or after close but this is outright dangerous! They'll shut the lights off while people are mid workout as well as the lights to the locker rooms without checking if people are in there (PRE CLOSE). I've gotten sass when having to ask for the lights to be turned on or told to use my flashlight when I only have one free hand and the gym is open which I'm paying for!!! This location treats its customers as if they were doing them a favor by allowing us to be there instead of people who are paying to be able to use the premises.

Also, a lot of these positive reviews are fake! The gym has now run multiple promotions where if you leave a POSITIVE review they'll give you discounts or guest passes.

Update 4/23/2024:

An employee shut off lights, claimed the gym was closed before their closing time. When I spoke up and said they weren't closed, the same two employees kept coming up & harassing me. I tried getting their names to make a report & the next time I came in I was told I was revoked. I've multiple times asked for why I'm being revoked in writing. Every time I have a verbal conversation with them I get told different stories. They are avoiding accountability as well as unwilling to be clear in writing. They have complaints about me that are related to me reporting safety issues.

Been coming to this gym for about 2 years now and have absolutely no complaints. The new management have been great as well, especially Jennifer. I was struggling with varying my workouts and she was able to point me in the right direction to one of her trainers and I've really been seeing results. She always asks how's my journey going and if there's anything I need never hesitate to reach out to her. She brings a friendly and personable vibe to the gym

Attentive staff! Professionalism up to par if not better than most luxury gyms I've been to! Jennifer the GM is very catering to members like myself ensuring all needs are met whenever I walk in the building, 10/10 would recommend this gym to anyone in Massachusetts!

I've been attending LA Fitness for 8 years, and have gained the most results than any gym that I've experienced in the past. My daughter has also been attending the daycare here for the past 2 years. Their staffs are attentive to all the kids there. The management and staffs as a whole are great here in Saugus.

Love this gym! It has more amenities than other gyms in the area at a reasonable price. The staff is all very helpful, especially the general manager Jennifer. She was so sweet  and knowledgeable when I had questions about what types of memberships are offered. Very happy with my experience here!
Great gym. Community gym vibe. Never too crowded and has everything you need!
Extremely clean, friendly staff and has everything you need. Great gym!
Monthly rate is reasonable. The gym is clean. Most times of the day is not very crowded.  AC thermostat is not set low enough on hot summer days.

Great gym, well earned 5 stars. Helpful staff found me the best option for a busy travel schedule. Do not hesitate if considering, stop in. Ignore the negative reviews, take into account the content and perspective of that feedback before settling. Thanks Flex.

The gym here is great. Part of the membership that is so valuable are the free classes. Personally I attend their Yoga class. This class is great no matter what age you are or fitness level. The instructor, Lisa is able to make it work for you by offering different poses and modifying them for your individual ability. You will come out of the class feeling rejuvenated, not only physically but mentally as well. And even if you are not a member you can pay for the class. You will be hard pressed to find any Yoga class around at this affordable rate ( now $7 ) at the high level of instruction Lisa provides! Give it a try!

Also the personal trainers are very well educated. As a former Physical Educator and coach at a local university in Boston, I am very impressed with one in particular that my partner and I are using, Sean Griffin.
He also is tuned in to the goals you want to accomplish and at the level of intensity you want to work at.

All in all Flex Fitness provides a great atmosphere to work out in, up to date and high end equipment, cleanliness, and classes for a variety of interests. Their rates are reasonable, so take the plunge and jump right in!

WARNING ABOUT MANAGEMENT

Had the most disgusting experience with the "manager" Marcelino. He is super rude and abrasive. He abuses his power of authority and is super in appropriate to female gym goers. ZERO stars.

The owner of this place is very unprofessional, he is always defensive, and not comprehensive of any situation, he only wants to play bossy and rude with you. He needs to learn more about what health is, because his gym is nice and everything but he put an air freshener super strong that you can barely breath, and you are only putting chemicals to your lungs.
Great local gym. Never too busy. Friendly staff. Very clean. All the equipment you need. Definitely ask about their personal trainers especially Sean!
Beautiful  and I have been doing this since the weekend before Thanksgiving
The iconic Saugus River been there since the 1600s to transport iron as it went through the waterways for transport still flowing freely
Good small place of nature.

The children's library is amazing!!  It all started with the 0-6 mth old classes and we just kept moving up! They offer so many classes and a large area in the back for children to play along side each other while being surrounded by books. This was a great environment that was full of kind and patient staff that made me feel comfortable as I taught my kids to use their library voices and how to play nice with other kids. The women at the desk always smiling at me!  My children's first teacher was Ms. Amy. I remember my kids and the other kids teetering over to the circular mats and pulling one out to sit on. As she read books to the little ears she used her puppets and would take them on an amazing animated journey . All the while teaching them to raise hands and listen with quiet patience without them even realizing. Now at 8yrs old my daughter is in a sewing class and we've used the math tutor services. My son at 11yrs ventures up to the adult section and is starting to learn all they offer for older kids. This library is managed beautifully!

This would not be a place I would take a 1-2 year old to even though they have programs/activities for that age range.  Library staff expects children that age to play in the children's room with library provided toys without being too noisy due to the open concept of the library.  Library staff will tell you "this will be a great opportunity to teach your child about having an inside voice in the library" when your 1-2 year old child is playing too loud with library provided toys.  Children that young do not always understand how to be quiet even in designated quiet spaces.  I believe this library should not have events geared for ages 0-4 if they are not understanding of how young children that age can be or do not want noises of young children who are still learning what quiet means.

Mary O'Connelly was so kind. I had to go in for back surgery and could barely walk. I had to get my toddler into daycare before my surgery. The clock was ticking before I went in for back surgery. Mary would help me by printing a few forms out for my mom to pick up for me. She didn't have to. But she went above and beyond to help me. And I thank you greatly for that. 

I have been going to this library since the 90s even before it got re-done. If you grew up in Saugus like I have the Library is nostalgic and never gets old.

Our family LOVES our local Libray!! All the staff have always been so welcoming and helpful to my children as well as myself. We really missed going during covid but we're so grateful they opened back up and we can go check out anything under the sun. Just FYI (Personally, not thrilled but the kids are) they also let you borrow games for pretty much any console you have.

I love this library!! I have been taking my son here since he was 2 years old.  (I would have been going earlier, but covid made that impossible.)

The staff here is amazing- especially Amy.  She introduced us to the "Read 1000 Books Before Kindergarten" club when he was 2.5 years old.  We are currently at 2103 books and he still has a year until he reaches kindergarten!  If not for her enthusiasm about reading and introducing him to a variety of books,  he would NOT be the reader he is today.

The library is really kid-friendly.  The murals on the wall,  bulletin boards, updated schedules with lists of events, weekly crafts, monthly themes and more make each trip worthwhile.  I have taken my son to many different branches, and this is definitely our favorite!! If not for their amazing staff, my son would not enjoy reading as much as he does today. For that, I am eternally grateful!!

Smells like feet, it is more like a children's arcade than a library as they are all there to play loud video games whilst yelling at each other. The table was also sticky for some reason. There is no quiet spot in there, so if you are  looking to get work done I would not suggest this library.
Books in bloom is a beautiful event.  Don't miss out seeing these creations.

Not bad, I loves libraries in general so I may be extra critical. A nice clean library, for the most part it's quite but the librarians can be a little loud and chatty. To be fair, i like to come here and their loudness is rare. There is a pizzeria right outside so you can always take a break and grab a bite to eat. Selection of books are very good. The selection seems geared toward middle and high-school kids, not that's a bad thing. My biggest complaint is that I can never find a table with an outlet in the middle like most other libraries. Maybe im not looking hard enough or im looking in the wrong section. I used one of their empty study rooms and one outlet was behind a huge file cabinet and the other was awkwardly across the other side of the room. I think rearranging some of their furniture would do wonders. Other than that, a solid library with respectful people.

Been going here for years and I've just about had it. Horrible horrible service, no matter how many times I say thank you the same stank face comes back. My kids don't need to see someone giving their dad/uncle disgusting attitude. Also says 48 inches minimum height for a driver to drive alone, my neohew measures at 52 inches. This happened twice already and I'm starting to think they wanted me to pay extra for him or they just have favorites. None the less I cannot wait for the day that place closes for good.
Best place to grab your Christmas tree!!! Update!! The weathers beautiful and the mini golf is up and running!! Jump on the go carts and finish with an ice cream!!! All days should be like this!!
My kids loved their mini golf course. It is very nice and well organized. Delicious ice cream,  and very friendly staff.

Lots of fun.
Only thing I think is they should offer seating that is separated not all clustered together (this is just my opinion ) and someone should be wiping down the tables better.
Heads up to people allergic there is a lot of bees around the playing area and it gets real hot standing in the sun.
Beautiful! The greens were challenging and fun. I got one mini golf pass and one go kart pass plus a coupon for the driving range across the street. A good place to pass the time.

Not worth the price!  This place needs so much TLC bad.  The putting greens are turning black and smell bad.  All 18 holes are cramping each other, no shade, trash on ground and in bushes.  Bricks around greens are loose and are tripping hazardous.    I gave it 2 stars because the ice cream was good and the staff was friendly.  But thats all it had going for it.
Awesome coffee milkshake.  Very tasty for $7.  Plus good miniature golf and battery go cart.
My grandsons had a great time playing mini-golf and eating ice cream. Thanks!
Great instruction World Class players and teachers.

My son has been going to DS Muay Thai squad since September. David and his team are amazing! They are so supportive of the kids. David makes the kids feel so confident. My son has changed in such positive ways learning the Muay Thai way of life. I can't recommend his kids classes enough!

I was coach davids first student about 2 and a half years ago when we had a small gym and not many members. The growth ive had technically and physically has been amazing. Ive learned more than i ever could through his classes. I was comfortable and confident from the beginning and love the sense of family. i cannot recommend starting muay thai with David enough. Beginner or pro we all started somewhere.

Great Muay Thai gym, the coach and members are respectful and show great sportsmanship.
Would highly recommend.

The best place to learn Martial arts! The coach David Silva are very friendly and professional and just by looking you can tell he is one of the best and love what he do. Very friendly ppl with a great energy! The best choice I did was setting up to be part of they team! Muay Thai became my favorite sport and now I'm obese with it. Thanks Ds Muay Thai for helping me with confidence and making me love Muay Thai. You won't regret for trying it.

Excellent environment for Muay Thai training. The coach David Silva is very knowledgeable and extremely easy going. The place is child and adult friendly. I have been coming for 3 weeks and I absolutely love it. Highly recommend to anyone looking to learn martial arts or simply get a GREAT workout.

I've been going for a few months now and my progress has been exponentially increasing! This is my first time doing this and I feel very confident about my abilities in a short time. There is a great sense of belonging and family within the gym and you're able to learn at your own pace. Never pictured myself enjoying a combat sport so much but I'm so glad I started when I did. I'm very happy with the experience every week and the coach's expertise and patience is a great tool in my ability to improve week after week. Cannot wait to see where this takes me definitely recommend trying it out!

Great atmosphere and very technically sound instructors. This place is great for both kids and adults. Whether you want to participate for workout purpose or to learn the skills to compete, this is a place I'd recommend. The coach's accolades speak for themselves.

Great place to start learning about technique and the fundamentals of martial arts especially Muy Thai. Been a member of this place for about 3 months and seen so much progress from not only me but my peers. Coach David is good coach to learn from And I'm excited to continue

My 6 year old son just started, he's a little shy but warming up surely and slowly. He loves it already. They teach so much here and their patient with the children. I love the lessons they do, I think it's very helpful for my son.
We love PMA! The staff is so friendly and amazing and the space is always super clean. My son loves coming and taking classes with his favorite instructor, Marya! Highly recommend!
My son went to the intro class, and loved it.  We signed up for the class that day and has since graduated to his next belt level.

I ordered a custom, artificial pumpkin from Sean (aka Fitzy) last year (2021), after finding him through Google. He was responsive and patient with my order. He made sure the mock-up was exactly what I wanted before proceeding. Since this was a present for my husband for our wedding, I wanted it to be perfect. Sean didn't make me feel bad for requesting changes and got back to me quickly with each edit. Once I approved the final mock-up, he got the order to me quickly, and it was just perfect! My husband and our guests loved it! At one point in the evening, one of our (possibly very intoxicated) guests came up and gushed to me about the pumpkin. To quote him, "That pumpkin is amazing! It's like...YOU! Like, a portrait of YOU! In a PUMPKIN!!!" I could not have said it better myself.

We got married October 2021 before Halloween, and we have now gotten to enjoy our pumpkin for two Halloweens. Each year, adults bringing their kids by for trick-or-treating stop and gape at our pumpkin and ask if it's real and if we carved it. (Someone this year literally had their mouth hanging open after they saw it, it's that impressive!) It is a keepsake we will treasure for many years to come! I highly recommend ordering a custom piece from Sean. He is professional, communicative, and his work is amazingly affordable for the quality. I will absolutely order from him again in the future!

*Photos included were taken by Greg Moss Photography. I included the original photo Sean was given for reference.

Very grateful to have found Fitzy Sculpting! There aren't many artists in this space and it was a pleasure working with someone so skilled and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend. Happy to know about these guys for future needs.
Sean was very quick to respond and provide fast service.  I received a quote within the hour of my inquiry and had a draft of my design later that evening.  Very professional and responsive!
Awesome sand sculptures love seeing them every year love the hearth 'n kettle one.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much!

review_text: Amazing sculpture at the Hearth and Kettle in Yarmouth MA

response_from_owner_text:
Olga,
I have no record of ever having done business with you.

review_text:
Weekend afternoons- extremely busy!! Even with the amount of parking available, it can get really packed.
Two big elevators are accessible as the escalator to go down with your cart is broken.

Review on bakery: Order their cakes/cupcakes!! For the fraction of the cost, being able to customize the cake or cupcakes or choosing the options they have online is fantastic. The cupcakes were light and airy and adding in a vanilla center made the cake and cupcake extremely delicious. The whipped frosting was light and not overly sweet. The blue food coloring did stain a shirt till washed. If you do see the mini donuts- grab them they too were a hit!

As always, it is a very good supermarket with a wide range of products and items for the whole family where you can find it and spend time making your most necessary purchases. You can also buy things for your home for your home, entertainment, video, audio and a great program of items that You can use it as an excellent place for a wide variety of things that you will always use.

Left my glasses tried to call to see if someone turned them in. They did not answer the phone. Have to drive back. The clerk held them for me.
Went back today. They are the nicest people. Remembered us. Kept the parking lot clean in this awful weather.
