review_text: This place, the instructors, and the pool area in general are fantastic. We've tried different programs in the past and saw little change in our child's skills. Here at British Swim School, he's gained confidence in the water, and we as parents feel relieved and delighted to watch him swimming with confidence. Thank you very much!
response_from_owner_text:
Angelica, thank you for your kind words! We're thrilled your son is gaining confidence in the water! You can trust our professional swim classes to help him continue to make progress. We're glad you are part of our swim family!
A safe swimmer is a happy swimmer! Peter, Owner of British Swim School at LA Fitness - Saugus

review_text: It's such a beautiful park but this year the lake is filled with seaweed. Its not swimmable. I hope this will get fixed because our family has so many memories here. We come here every year but were not able to swim today unfortunately.

Its beautiful here during the spring and summer. Such a great place for a walk in nature. I love that its so close for me to get out of the city and be in the woods. Definitely a peaceful place to clear your mind. Good walking area.  I never realized how big Breakheart actually is until today when I ended up in places I've never even seen in there before. Considering I've been walking here for years.
Love the paved paths! Great for a nice stroll through the woods with small hills too. There are picnic tables and nice views overlooking the lakes. Excited to swim here as well!

Great hiking area where you can get a view of the Boston skyline from Breakheart Hill and lots of other views of lakes and ponds along the way. We hiked 5 miles of trails but there was still a lot more we could have done. There's a lot of elevation changes so you're going up and down quite a bit. With so many rocks on the trails, wearing boots would be very helpful.
Lots of parking available but on weekends during summer might be difficult to find spot due to the small beach access from this entrance.
Nice peaceful hiking, unless you go in the summer recently the beach has become Bogata Columbia 2.0 boom boxes and all.
Great place to walk in the woods. Take your dog with you.

Oooh this place is great!! Walked for nearly two hours (sort of lost) in the trails. Great place for long walks, swimming areas, awesome place. Meet some staff along the way (adorable people too; very polite) loved it~ definitely going back again~

Best simulator around.... Hands down. The hospitality in this place is un matched. Very interactive group they have on staff there. Also the simulators are like no other in quality. You will not be disappointed choosing flogolf for your next golf outing!

I've been going to Alta Performance for almost 2 months now and I love how they customize the programs to fit each client's personal needs. They're experts with the educational background and knowledge at working on balance, strength and conditioning.
The level of challenge is just right, they won't push you too hard but they won't let you seat on your comfort zone.

The facility is very well kept with top notch equipments and it has an upbeat vibe.
It's conveniently located on Broadway in Saugus, and it has plenty of parking space.

Shannon and Michael are awesome and I love going there!

I highly recommend Alta Performance for anyone who is looking for an ultimate strength and conditioning program. They surely walk side by side with you towards achieving your fitness goals!

Cannot say enough good things about Shannon and the facility at ALTA. My son and daughter have been attending  for Youth Training classes and it is the highlight of their, very busy, week. Mainly because they feel motivated by Shannon and can see the progress they are making with her clear and customized program. We have attended a few other youth trainers and nothing compares . We know everything Shannon is doing is positive and age appropriate and we are grateful to have found ALTA!

I have had a wonderful experience at Alta Performance working with Shannon.
I joined to work on my balance and strength.  She was immediately able to key in on my issues, and target exercises that helped me improve.
With Shannon's assistance and technical skills, I have improved my quality of life, and also my golf performance!
I highly recommend Shannon and Alta Performance!

The personal training experience has been excellent.  I have worked with both Jared and Shannon and their approach has been great. In addition the work out space and equipment are top notch. I recommend Alta Performance for anyone who is looking for an optimal strength and conditioning program.  They definitely push you towards your goals.

Shannon has such a positive attitude and makes all feel welcome. When I first started I was not in shape at all. I've spent 3 months with Shannon twice a week and I already feel such a difference. She knows just how much to push for results. Happy being at ALTA with Shannon!

I've been working on balance, core, strength, and posture at Alta with Shannon for a little over a month.  I am starting to see the reemergence of muscles on my arms and legs.  The exercises are fun and the atmosphere is non judgmental.  The gym is spotless and a pleasant area in which to work out.   I highly recommend Atla to anyone that wants to improve their health and strength.

Shannon provides top quality care/service. I started seeing her a few years ago at a different t office after a bad car accident.

Her knowledge on my type of injuries, especially the neurological side of it, enabled her to help me more than any other specialist I saw during that time. There were many times I would come in for treatment and she would have something new that she researched over the weekend to try. It was always very fluid and progressive treatment. The way it should be.

It was a true loss for me when she left that establishment. I was unable to find another PT with the knowledge or talent to tend to the conditions I had. I continued with her at home exercises while seeing a mediocre therapist elsewhere.

When she opened Alta Performance I quickly jumped at the opportunity to start with her again. The facility is very well equipped, brand new and the experience with her at this location is very 1 on 1. I highly recommend for both physical therapy and conditioning.

Shannon is knowledgeable, dedicated and enthusiastic with those she works with.  I see her specifically for injury recovery and prevention.  She is sure to adjust everything to my specific needs, truly listens throughout the process, and is devoted to my recovery and my longterm success.
Intentional class design to help kids with coordination and confidence (while having a ton of fun)! The coaches get to know each child and take pride in their progress.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Annie. We appreciate you taking the time to leave our team a positive review.  We truly love working with each student,  challenging them at their own level and celebrating their progress!

review_text: My 7yo daughter has a been at Flips for over 3 years. My 4yo son has also started classes there. I can not say enough good things about this gym. My son has SPD & ADHD & more. It is hard for him to feel comfortable with others. The coaches made sure he felt comfortable no matter how long it took. He loves going now and counts down the days. My daughter is eager to excel and learn new skills. The staff is always happy to help her with the skills she wants to work on. My children adore all the coaches; especially Coach Gianna. She has been a big support for my kids since day one. The owner Karen is amazing. She always seems to find a way to make our special circumstances attainable. She has been so flexible and compassionate to our family. You will not find a better gym nor staff than the Flips family
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your positive review and for sharing your experience with our facility.  We truly enjoy watching your children grow and learn new skills! We hope to continue to meet and exceed your expectations!

review_text: These people are incredible with young kids... This was the first organized activity we got our daughter involved with and it was awesome for her.  It takes EXPERTS to keep a group of 3 year olds engaged for 45 minutes and these coaches  are clearly experts.  The gym is so thoughtfully prepared each week with all sorts of engaging activities and the coaches have each been so wonderful... somehow managing to give all of the 1 on 1 attention that each kid needs while simultaneously conducting group activities.  100% recommend to anyone who can do it!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a positive review. You kind words and confidence in our instruction means so much! We love working with your daughter and the rest of the students each week and hope to continue to meet and exceed your expectations.

review_text: My daughter loves coming here. Staff is great!!! They have a class for kids with special needs and they each get their own instructor/ helper.  So glad we found this place!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you, Jeremie, for taking the time to give us a positive review.  We love working with all of our students and the Super Heroes classes are some of our most rewarding.  So grateful for your support!

review_text: We love Flips R 4 Kids! This is my son's second session and he looks forward to class each week. Very clean,organized and small class sizes so each child gets attention. They really work with their students to help them feel safe and confident!
response_from_owner_text: Maggie, thank you for taking the time to give us a positive review.  We love working with your son during our Ninja classes each week.  We hope to continue to meet and exceed your expectations and to help your son learn life skills through our weekly lessons.

review_text:
Read till the end!
The coaches are unprofessional, they do not teach basic safety fundamentals and put kids at risk. I was watching how the kids were doing the forward roll with the reliance on their heads with necks bending which is a huge, dangerous mistake. The first rule every gymnastics professional knows: hide your head between legs, land on the upper part of your back, not your head. These coaches did not watch and did not TEACH the kids to do the forward roll correctly. It happens with the other exercises as well. When I went to the coaches and said that they ignored dangerous things they did not get me. I asked them: what you should land on - and they could not answer. Sent me to a manager. The manager actually did not care, nodded and returned me money. Of course I was not going to go back to that place but for them it is even better - no problematic customers.
the place is a machine of gathering money, a conveyor. Around 40+ kids at the same time at the same room not enough for that amount, in masks... terrible! I went back to YMCA with a huuuuuge room for gymnastics, better equipment and more attentive coaches.
Be mindful when you choose the coaches, gymnastics is a very traumatic sport, safety is first. Better choose coaches from the Eastern Europe or USSR who have always had wonderful sport schools, focused on quality, not money.
I'm shocked by the previous 5 star reviews. After reading them I realized parents just could not make a relevant analysis and judgement, perhaps due to lack of experience. Sad.
response_from_owner_text:
Thank you for taking the time to review our facility.  It has been four months since your children attended their 2 classes and we are happy that you found a facility that works for your family.

At Flips R 4 Kids, safety is and has always been our #1 concern.  In our beginner classes for young children, following directions and teaching the drills necessary to safely succeed on each event is what our staff focuses on.

We appreciate any and all feedback in order to continue to serve our customers and keep our students safe.

review_text: My daughter started here 10 years ago and now has a great gymnastics career.  She is a captain on the high school gymnastics team and she now works here too!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for taking time to review our program.  We appreciate your loyalty and continued support.  Your daughter is a wonderful addition to our team and loved by all her students and co-workers.

review_text: So clean and very structured! Such a fun environment and the kids love it!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Tiffany for taking the time to give us a positive review. We love working with your girls each week!  We appreciate your kind words : )

review_text: My name is Sue Palomba with Mango Realty.  Everyone at Town Hall is most likely very pleasant and they do reach out within 48 hours.  Thank You To everyone that works at town hall.

Have been married Since September 2020 and until now i have not received my copy of the marriage license. I have called multiple times and the only answer that I get is that it is processing. The women is super rude and i saw how she treats her employees. Really dont know how she even has her job.
Unbelievable!

Forget the beautiful building the people inside GET S@#T DONE!! What a change moving from Boston to Saugus. The first time I needed to go to city hall I was really hesitant, thinking it was going to be like a trip to old RMV in Chinatown. But boy was I wrong. I was out in les than 10 min. Everyone is nice and everyone is always available. Well  maybe not Fred Varone he is busy guy.
The town hall is big and has a clock above. Also across the library .
Wow. Are you kidding me
Amo este lugar principalmente nesta epoca linda do inverno!
review_translated_text: I love this place especially at this beautiful time of winter!

review_text:
This was such a good place to play billiards. We plan for a date night and spent about 2 hours in here. A big green table, at the end part of the club was offered to us. It looked like a private area, which we enjoyed.
Although it was an old building, meaning not a fancy place, it was full of player with many tables to play.
Possible to buy drink, or small snacks.
Not pricey.

Semi Reposting from Yelp!

A shiny gem! I didn't realize the outside was a bit sketchy. PARKING IS ENFORCED AFTER 5 ON WEEKDAYS, which I have learned very clearly haha, other than that. A great place to come and play a quick game of pool, a little quiet but enjoyable. I would totally recommend everyone to come, but do not be intimidated by the dark dingy building and parking lot.

I also got to meet a nice man named Jacomo (probably butchered his name) who taught us a nice lesson of snooker! Kind man and got to have a tour.

Park in the lot and come up through the stairs, eventually you'll see the grand hall! :)
Bo "Boe" (?) Was extremely helpful and not intimidating at all for a novice. The whole experience was pleasant, inclusive, and welcoming.

It's a pool hall where people go to improve and practice thier game  it does not pretend to be anything else ,just like any sporting  event they don't sell alcohol ,we don't complain about local football soccer or baseball fields not serving alcohol so why expect it here ,courteous friendly staff and amazing equipment. What more do we need

Was very unwelcoming. I went in to play pool here for the first time and did waited around by the front desk and couldn't not see a single employee for the 10 min I stood there. All I got was awkward stares it is probably fun if you know the place not new comers.

If not the best pool haul in the state. Very hospital. A great place to go and have fun. Bring a friend and experience outhers and make friends..Thats what it's all about..5 stars if I could give more I would
Everything is top notch. Staff is excellent and alway keeping up with all safety measures, Everyone needs to stop in if in the area. Must see in person.  Kind and friendly establishment for all ages

One of the nicest wnd biggest pool halls on east cost, place includes lots of 9ft tables three, 3cushion tables and even a snooker table, everytime I make the trip to Boston I have to come and shoot, looking forward coming to play in a weekend tournament soon

A great place for a family to grow up, in an area that used to have more alleys. The only downsides are the awkwardly spaced parking lot and cash-only, though cash is available at the supermarket next door.

My family's been in Wakefield or Melrose for many generations. Three generations including me have been raised with the Bowladrome, and my extended family would often bowl there 12/26 when folks traveled to Mass for Christmas.

Now it's a known TV and movie set, and I live a half mile away. I visit with Wakefield friends sometimes, like this holiday weekend.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your review Julia! We hope to see you again soon!

review_text: What a great location for fun with family and friends. We attended my sister's 70th birthday party here and enjoyed bowling and lots of laughs. There were kids and adults alike. The kids, as young as 2 had a ball! They were able roll the balls down the gutter since there are no bumpers, bowl in different lanes that we were assigned and roll the bowl sloooowly. Nothing automatic here, push the button for reset, paper score sheets and old style seating. I can see why this location has been used in so many movies.  Don't miss visiting here!
response_from_owner_text: Nick, Thank you for your review! We were honored to have you celebrate your sister's birthday with us. Happy Birthday to her! We hope to see you again in the future.

review_text: Went the other day for the first time and had a blast! The staff were really friendly and answered all of our questions. It was $28 per hour for the lane plus $2 shoe rentals. We will be back!

Great place.  My son triumphantly tossed the ball in joy (see pic).  I'm glad I can go.  A bit costly but I can't blame them and everything's expensive these days.

P.S. Any discount you can offer me is appreciated?
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your review! We hope to see you again soon!

review_text: My wife, daughter and I came here for the first time this evening (Sat. 12/30/23).  League bowling was about to start and all non-league lanes were busy.  The gentleman at the counter was friendly and really nice; he apologized, and gave me an idea about how long it might be until a lane would free up.  While we waited (it took a while) he and we chatted about things like how candlepin bowling is only available in this area of the US, the old TV program "Candlepins for Cash", another bowling alley I had called (no names) and the unpleasant guy who answered, and the "Blizzard of '78".  We had fun, the price was right, the counter man and other customers were very nice, and there were families with little kids.  We'll be back.
response_from_owner_text: John, Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review! I am happy to hear that you enjoyed the experience and will return. I will pass on your comments to Paul, the gentleman you spoke with. We look forward to seeing you again soon! - Happy New Year! - Gerry

review_text: Fantastic! Have been going for a few events with my kiddos. I use to go when I was younger. Happy to be bowling again
Awesome inexpensive family fun. Very lucky to have this place right downtown all these years.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your 5-Star review! We hope to see you again soon

review_text: I absolutely love this place! It brings you back in time with the old school feel.  Not many of these places exist anymore, so be sure to stop in! You have candle pin bowling and paper to keep score. It is cash only, so be sure to bring enough, but it's totally worth visiting!

Had such a fun time at this place with coworkers. A perfect place for team building or just having fun.
Some of the  quests can be challenging physically, but you can choose rooms based on colors for your own taste.
response_from_owner_text: Glad you had fun, and thanks for the review!

review_text: Took my daughter & her friends here for her birthday. They had a blast! It was easy to reserve spots online. Other parents could submit waiver through link. We arrived about 10-15 mins early no problem. It was tough to find parking-so plan ahead. They had a large lounge area with different seating arrangements for those not participating or those needing a break. Some snacks & drinks available. Small & med lockers for free. They had larger lockers for suitcases, but not sure if you have to pay. The kids had a blast & can't wait to go back. Such a fun place. Would definitely go back

It's been a few years since I visited, and I was surprised because some of our old favorite quests are still there, but they have managed to mix up the solutions somehow. The quests we quickly conquered before were suddenly hard again - which of course also made it challenging, and oddly extremely fun. I think that's a very smart move on their part. It's a fantastic way to challenge yourself, get a good workout, and tax your brain cells. It wouldn't be this much fun if it were too easy. We'll definitely be back!
response_from_owner_text: Glad you had fun! While we do aim to replace around 4 Quests a year, we also do like to tweak the challenges of existing Quests as well. Thanks for the review!

review_text:
You're going to fail multiple times and get frustrated but it's fun to try again and slowly progress.

Best way to describe this place is a bunch of individually themed quests with multiple parts. There's normally 3-4 parts/rooms to 1 quest line. There are no rules to the room that are posted, the only hints you have about the quest is the plaque on the door with the name of the quest and maybe a one liner. The rooms are run by a program, no live humans watching you like an escape room.

The rooms are laid out in multiple hallways, doors that start the quest will have a plaque. There's a screen over the door that will be a solid green emblem or blinking green emblem. Solid means the room is empty and ready to be entered, blinking means the room is occupied.

There's a screen in the room that will have the flashing green emblem when you enter and the quest is live. If you fail the quest by doing something you shouldn't or time out you will buzz out and the screen/emblem will turn red. It's not always clear how or why you failed the room. Once you exit you can immediately try again if there's no line and the emblem is a solid green. Depending on the time there's normally a 1-2 group queue but the line moves fast. Generally you have less than a 5 minute wait to get into a room but some waits are longer pending the line. The bonus about failing frequently is many groups can try at once and some group who can get through a section quickly will make room for the next group to start.

You need a group between 3-5, all rooms can be done with that number but some rooms are easier or harder with a different number. If you're super hardcore and have done most of the rooms you can take the quest master challenge and attempt to complete all the quests in 4 hours. This will likely require several visits prior to your attempt to train. We spent about 4 hours just checking out the different rooms and only completed 2, came close to completing another 2 and failed many times. Would definitely come back here.

The area is pretty safe and you had packs of middle school kids running around on rainy days with no direct parental supervision. There's a waiting area upstairs where you can sit and relax there are some drinks available. Staff was amazing and super helpful and kind. Would definitely come here again

This place is one of my top favorite places to go when I'm in the Boston area! It's an incredibly unique concept and man does this feel like something that I'd want to have closer to me in the bay.

Good:
- Creative concepts and really cool rooms!
- Love how if you fail you can try again
- It's a good bonding activity
- It's so cool how there are both physical and mental challenges

Bad:
- Sometimes the wait time for the rooms is long! But overall you do go in and out fast especially when the day isn't too busy
response_from_owner_text: Thank you! Glad you had such a great time...hopefully one day we'll have Boda Borgs all over the world, including in the Bay!

review_text: Super fun place. Family of 5 ranging from 7 to 38 had a blast. Wish we went for the four hours. Only ding is I wish they kept their bathroom clean. Trash overflowing.

I went with my partner, my sister and her partner on a Saturday evening. It was my first time ever going to a escape room and my expectation was that it would be a large, single space which we would have lots of times to figure the mystery before moving on.

What Boda Borg does instead is a bunch of different rooms, with much more limited time such as 1 minute, where you need to solve the puzzle/mystery of the room before moving on the next level of the same room. If you don't succeed before the timer, you will have to start at level 1 of the room.

We really enjoyed our time although it was very crowded. We went during a busy time and I felt like the large number of people detracted from the experience as it created larger wait times. There were some rooms we really enjoyed but other where it was either permanently closed or so popular that the wait time was very long.

Overall, an enjoyable experience but would recommend less busy times so you have more time to try more rooms and less time waiting around.
response_from_owner_text: Glad you had fun! We do limit the number of people at any one time, but agree that it's the most fun when we're less busy. Most weekdays are much less busy than weekends, and if you're coming on a weekend it's usually best close to open or in the evening. (Sunday evening is often the least crowded.)

review_text: Very fun! Be warned - definitely take care and be real about your physical abilities if you're over 30 - I'm sitting on my couch after a fun evening which ended in a hamstring injury in a darkly lit more physically challenging room (black door). I recommend warming up and stretching before entering any black room.

I had my son's 13th birthday party here and the staff/ event coordinator could not have been more kind and helpful! I had 12 kiddos and a few adults and we all enjoyed ourselves to the fullest! Our server Madeline was fantastic and didn't miss a thing. I am in the service industry, and I am typically a tough critic, However, our experience was  great, so we were very pleased.! Great job kings!! We will be back:)
Thank you Courtney!!
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Jodie, 
Thank you for taking the time to leave us this five star review. We are glad everyone had a great time and will definately pass this along to Madison, Courtney & the rest of the team here in Lynnfield! Cheers, Kayla Boebel- Beverage & Sales Manager

review_text: My group was put in the waitlist almost three hours before we where texted that we where next up. After arriving quickly after this text we checked in with the woman at the front desk who said our lanes would be ready shortly (around 5 minuets) after waiting just more that 15 minuets with no communication we went and asked again. This was when they decided to bring up the rule that we must have a member of the group 18+. However, this same woman is the one who confirmed with an adult hours before that we where on the wait list. She went on to blame the "general policy" list and immediately canceled our reservation with no closure. After completing going through the website there was absolutely no mention of this rule and after a scavenger hunt to find the only visible  general policy list they claimed was hanging up by the door we where met with a poster the size of printing paper hanging up in a very dark hall and about a foot off the ground in a corner. The font was so small and the room so dark that we needed a phone flashlight to read. No where on that poster did it mention even the number 18 let alone the need to have a member over 18. The most disappointing part of this experience is the lack of communication from both staff and the website. How hard could it possibly be to put this in your website instead of using the equivalent to a scrunched up piece of paper in the corner. Horrible experience and  led to one of the biggest wastes of time.  Don't waste your time !
response_from_owner_text:
Good afternoon Hazel,
Thank you for taking the time to give me your feedback.  I want to apologize for the inconvenience that was caused last night.  I do agree that we are not communicating our policies well to our guests on the website. I will fix that right away with our Marketing Team. So you are aware, Kings follows the Market Street Plaza policy that all minors have to be accompanied by an adult after 6pm. That information is posted at every entrance. We are working quickly to have this information more available to our guests to prevent this from happening to someone else. 

Thank you,
Matthew DePaolo

review_text: We had my son's 5th birthday here and everyone had a blast. Everything from planning the event, to setting it up when we got there, ordering food, and keeping everyone busy was seamless. Kids had a great time bowling, eating pizza, and playing in the arcade. We had the lane for 2 hours which was more than enough time. Staff was prompt and friendly. Would highly recommend.

We had a group event of 16 people and we had a blast! Our waitress was friendly and attentive. The manager was also nice. The boom boom shrimp and buffalo chicken wontons were our favorite. We would definitely book another event here.
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Josue, 
Thank you for the five-star review! We will share your compliments with the team, and we hope to see you again soon. 
Kayla Boebel- Beverage & Sales Manager

review_text: We had a company event at Kings about 20 people. It was fantastic. The food and drinks were great. Our server was on top of things, very attentive and helpful. Great place. Everyone had a good time
response_from_owner_text:
Good afternoon Kristin.  We're thrilled to hear that your company event was a success and that everyone had a good time. It's wonderful to know that our food, drinks, and attentive service exceeded your expectations. Thank you for choosing us for your event and for your positive feedback. We look forward to hosting you again in the future.

Thank you,
Matthew DePaolo

review_text: Our experience at Kings in Lynnfield for our Teen Ambassador Holiday Party was perfect. Our server, and really everyone on that evening, could not have been more attentive to our needs.  This is exactly why we selected Kings for our party!!  Connor's Kindness Project!
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Connors Kindness Project,
Thank you so much for choosing Kings for your Teen Ambassador Holiday Party and taking the time to leave us a five-star review! I will pass on your compliments to the team here. We hope to have you and your team back again with us soon. 
Kayla Boebel- Beverage & Sales Manager

review_text: We did a corporate outing for 2 hours.  We are a small HVAC company with 25 diverse employees.  Not easy to gather this group for any occasion.  We felt welcomed, received great service and the team had a really good time.
response_from_owner_text:
Good afternoon Christopher.  We're thrilled to hear that your corporate outing was a success and that our service met your expectations. It's always our goal to provide a welcoming environment for all our guests. Thank you for choosing us for your event and for the positive feedback. We hope to see you back in the near future.

Thank you,
Matthew DePaolo

review_text: We celebrated my husband's birthday last Sunday with a Patriot's themed party in the lounge and I cannot say enough how amazing everyone was there.  From the moment I walked in to the minute I left every single person who helped me was outstanding.  Every person that attended the party had the same feedback about the staff and the space.  Everyone felt welcomed and well taken care of and the food was great!  King's made it so easy to celebrate and for me to enjoy the celebration while hosting.  Special shout out to our servers/bartender who made the whole party fun and everything run seamlessly - thanks Nate, Amber, Maddie & Hannah!
A nice nostalgic landmark for Rock Circuit Trail, starting from Middlesex East parking lot and going counterclockwise. It let one know near home.

Can someone tell me where the entrance is. The 220 E Border road address is just a wooded area with no paths. I've driven there and walked there but can't find any marked area. Maybe mapquest is incorrect. Would love to hike it but can't find it - help? Will give a better review once I find it...
The hike up to the observatory is beautiful, we did it in winter with snow and greatly enjoyed it. The trails are clearly marked and well maintained. We had a snowball fight.
Beautiful hike, not super intense, great place to forget about the city life for a few hours. For parking, you have to keep driving down the street, there's two very small areas for about 7-8 cars
Great mountain biking.
Really great spot, limited seating available
Cool rocky uphill trials pretty fun
Real hard core hiking region

place_name: Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore
review_text: We boarded our four month old mini Goldendoodle puppy for three nights here with a additional "puppy play" service added for each day. The check-in process was easy and very re assuring (our first time using a boarding service). Communication throughout the stay was great and a grooming service provided before our pups pick up. Would recommend this Red Dog location for it's puppy boarding services. Our girl was so sleepy when we brought her home, it was great to see that she was getting enough play and exercise whilst staying with Red Dog.
response_from_owner_text:
Alexandra,
Thank you so much for choosing Red Dog for your mini Goldendoodle puppy's boarding needs and for taking the time to share your experience with us! We're thrilled to hear that your first-time boarding experience with us was reassuring and seamless.

Ensuring your puppy's comfort and happiness is our priority, and we're delighted that our "puppy play" service provided her with plenty of playtime and exercise. It's heartwarming to know she returned home sleepy and content!

We appreciate your kind words about our check-in process, communication throughout the stay, and grooming service. Your recommendation means a lot to us, and we look forward to welcoming your pup back for more fun-filled stays in the future.

place_name: Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore
review_text: I have a nervous pup and he and his brother did very well.  He settled in well and loved all the employees.  It was such a relief to have a camera to check on them.  The only thing I would wish to change is being able to bring in a bed from home.  Otherwise Red Dog is a wonderful place for your pup!
response_from_owner_text: We thank you for recognizing our exceptional services for your furry companion. As you know, we do more than doggie day care. You can count on us for fully-staffed 24/7 care, upgraded private suites and villas. You'll even receive a report card when you check out! We look forward to continuing to be your preferred resource for pet care.

place_name: Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore
review_text:
We have had a great experience bringing our puppies here.

Red Dog offers many different rooms to accommodate different types of dogs. You can schedule private playtime, there's daycare, plenty of walks. The staff is incredibly nice & you can see that they are animal lovers themselves.

Red Dog is our go-to whenever we need to board the pups. I highly recommend them.
response_from_owner_text: Mike, we are thrilled that Red Dog is your go-to place for dog day care and overnight accommodations. As you know, our expert staff groups dogs according to temperament and makes sure they get plenty of exercise. We deeply appreciate your recommendation as well as your fantastic five-star review. We look forward to seeing you and your pups again soon.

place_name: Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore
review_text: We are incredibly happy with our experience boarding our black lab at Red Dog. This was our first time. The info on their website is very helpful to know what to expect for his stay. We had to extend his boarding due to a flight cancellation and the team was very easy to work with for that. When we picked our dog up, he was over-the-moon excited. He loves being boarded but he had an excitement with his for the rest of the day we have never seen before. I love the thought that went into the team writing his report card. You can tell that the team really cares about the dogs that they deal with. I can't say enough good things about our experience with Red Dog. We love how many options they have for boarding such as the patios. Highly recommend them for boarding.
response_from_owner_text: Welcome to Red Dog Northshore! We thank you Brian for recognizing our exceptional services for your furry companion. As you know, we do more than overnight accommodations. You can count on us for dog daycare and grooming. We look forward to continuing to be your preferred resource for pet care.

place_name: Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore
review_text: This was Teddy's first stay at Red Dog and he had a very positive experience.  He came home much more relaxed than from other places where he has stayed.  He was uninterested in eating in the beginning but Red Dog called us and we came up with a plan that would get him eating but also keep his sensitive stomach in mind.  The facility is super clean and the staff is really friendly and obviously cares about the pets in their care.  Teddy will definitely be visiting again!  Thank you!
response_from_owner_text: Welcome to Red Dog! We enjoyed Teddy's visit with us. As you discovered, we have no hesitation about contacting pet parents when we suspect your fur baby might have a challenge. We are glad Teddy ate and had a wonderful time with new friends. Thanks, Karen, for your terrific five-star review.

place_name: Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore
review_text: Pam is a phenomenal groomer. Our baby arrived scruffy looking like she was unloved and uncared for (we love her dearly and do the best that we can) she came out looking like she was groomed for a professional dog show
response_from_owner_text: Cessy, thank you for your exceptional five-star review of Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore.  As you know, we believe our furry family members should have a fun, happy and clean environment when they are our guests. Since we are family operated we treat dogs like they are our own. We look forward to seeing you back soon for more wonderful grooming and perhaps some dog daycare!

place_name: Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore
review_text:
Update: My Lucy girl has been going here now more often and never had a bad experience. She always comes out super happy. Now if only she would take a breather from playing and having fun to eat her lunch  :D

My puppy has gone there twice and so far so good. She seems to sleep well after and doesn't hesitate going in with the staff so I feel good about leaving my baby there.
response_from_owner_text: Heather, thanks for the update. We are so glad that your pup has adjusted so well to Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore.  As you know, we believe our furry family members should have a fun, happy and clean environment when they are our guests. Since we are family operated we treat dogs like they are our own. We look forward to seeing you and your precious girl back for more five-star experiences.

place_name: Red Dog Pet Resort & Spa Northshore
review_text: My dog Ellie absolutely LOVES going to Red Dog. Whether it's a day at day care or lengthy stats boarding, I feel so comfortable knowing she's being taken care of and lived on by the amazing staff. She always runs in happy and comes home happy (and exhausted!) The grooming is also fantastic!
response_from_owner_text: Amy, we once again thank you for recognizing our exceptional services for Ellie. We're so pleased that she adores our dog day care, overnight accommodations and grooming. We can't thank you enough for the five-star review!

review_text: The price is fair and something for everyone: great staff and customer service. I feel safe that my kids have a friendly environment to grow. As a disabled veteran with multiple difficulties, I appreciate having a place to keep in shape. I'm so grateful for all the programs available at the Torigian Y.

The staff are really nice and the pool is great. But they have ONE lap lane open with six lanes in total. They have the swim team take up FOUR lanes, swim instructors do one, and that leaves all of us who pay and come after work to get ONE lane. Even sharing that's not feasible. C'mon, management. This is ridiculous. Give at least two lanes so at least four of us can swim. Oh and the schedule changes weekly so good luck trying to switch days.

Very unprofessional and disappointing

Big fan of Camp Eastman. It's awesome picking up a tired and messy kiddo after a long day in the office. Each day is enthusiastically described in detail of all the fun they had. After a long school year and extra curricular activities. My child is enjoying the fresh air, sunshine, no screens and friends. Camp Eastman is what summer camp should be!!
I was nervous starting. It had been a while. Everyone is very friendly and made me feel welcome. If the staff doesn't really care they do good job of faking it! Thank you.
The gym is always well kept machines clean and always available,staff very helpful and facility locker room very sanitary.
My son and daughter love camp Eastman, they are having a lot of fun. Thank you all for your wonderful work.
Nick is great!  The adult pickleball leagues were well organized and super fun!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you, Beth!

review_text: They offer a lot for the price. The hours are great for early birds or people who are more motivated later in the day. The workout floor can get busy and parking lot can be pretty full during peak hours, but not the fault of the Y. The machines are well taken care of and rotated out when they get old. I really like the personal training offerings and excited to try pickleball and see what all the hype is about. I wish it was bigger so there could be more offerings like gymnastics or kickboxing.

Out of all the Rock Spot Climbing locations in MA, this is by far my least favorite one. It is the tiniest and most boring one of all. Only bouldering. Went on a Saturday morning and it was quiet and honestly depressing. I felt bad for the staff. Plenty of street parking and restaurants around and commute on T is easy as Malden T station is literally across the street.

Went there yesterday did not like it at all and the price they charge is ridiculously high 36 dollars and the place is sooo small the staff was very nice but they shouldn't charge that much  to climb robbery don't go here waist of money and your hands hurt after so boring never again. Waist of money
My kids and I, first time climbers, had a great time here. The staff were helpful and friendly and it was a great winter activity to do with my kids. We'll definitely be back.

Love this gym! Friendly environment, knowledgeable staff, and reasonable setting.

Tina and Jose have been a wealth of knowledge as I've been learning to climb. Honestly they turned a passing curiosity into a 3x weekly routine with a membership :)

Alec, Grace and Tina are very kind and helpful. Facilities are clean, there's constantly challenging stuff to keep you stimulated but it's great for beginners like me because the people are willing to teach.

Boutique rock climbing gym, but with everything you need. I like it opens until 11pm so late night workout is great, and the climbing routes gets changed once a while so you have new challenges, I can only climb level 1-2 with occasional 3s, but still a good selection of routes. Convenient location too!

This has become my main climbing gym from the instant I got the intro. There is only bouldering at this gym, but the community and the staff here cannot be beat at any other climbing gym. Everyone is so welcoming and excited to talk about their favorite activity.

There is a reason why staff from all the other gyms in the area come here to get some chill climbing in.

Great bouldering gym with fun route-setting and a super convenient location!
It's kinda expensive though. A month-to-month family membership here costs the same as a much larger rock gym nearby, and there is no discount for buying the membership annually.
Paying more while losing the option for auto-belay, top-rope, and lead is tough.

I entered through the cross fells trail end which is on Goodyear end road. From Washington.

It's a really short walk to the small waterfalls. Maybe 10minutes following the few signs.

There are some small bridges. Steps on the trails. It can get slippery especially when it rains. Come prepared. Also no bathrooms or parking lot from the east side.

The waterfalls were small but nice to see with minimal effort. Free fun activity

I saw couples families and groups of friends going on walks. Nice place. Don't leave trash please.

The quality of this Cascade can vary based on rainflow and the time of year but it's pretty nice considering it's essentially in a metropolis. Head north and then East to exit or head north and then West to follow the water

The address is on Washington. But there was no parking there. You need to follow the road to the parking lot on Fellsway East. Then cross the street to the hiking trail. Follow the blue marks on the trees. Then at the end, follow the yellow marks to get to the water falls. Wear mosquito spray because there are a lot of mosquitos there. The trail is easy for 9 years old and adults. But it will be a challenge for 75 years old or 4 years old.

This waterfall is great in the spring or after rain falls. The total height is actually surprisingly large (a few stories). In winter, when the temperatures drop below freezing it is pretty common to see groups of ice climbers practicing there for hours.
Will it blow your mind? No. Is it amazing that there is a waterfall within a 30 min train +walking trip from Downtown Boston? Yes, absolutely.

We parked on Goodyear Avenue (2 hours free parking) and walked to the falls, which took 5/10 minutes and was signposted. It's a little undulating on the walk but was fine for all of us. Not the most spectacular falls but we were filling some time before a flight and it was nice to see. We were there in august so not much water and quite a lot of plant growth obscuring views so likely better in the winter/spring.
Treasure close to Boston but trails to the cascade not marked.  It meant many extra steps.  Also be careful on the upper part..m trust me.  Still a very nice place
Great walk up to the water fall. And a short distance walk to the lookout point to see the city.

A fun course for the weekend player. Mostly flat, in generally good condition (a few of the tee boxes are in rough shape). The greens are large and have difficult contours. I enjoyed my 9 and will certainly return. A very good value close to home.

Nice course, well maintained and great prices. E walked but will ride next time.

**Headline: Memorable Golf Day at Cedar Glen with FoxholeP Leading the Pack**

*SAUGUS, MA* - The picturesque Cedar Glen Golf Course in Saugus hosted a thrilling golf day yesterday, marked by competitive spirit and camaraderie among the participants. The standout performer of the day was FoxholeP, who managed to edge out the competition with a solid round, earning the distinction of "sucking the least."

FoxholeP's performance was marked by consistency and precision, navigating the challenging fairways and tricky greens of Cedar Glen with remarkable skill. His steady play and strategic approach paid off, as he avoided major pitfalls and kept his score low.

Not far behind, Glenzo, BDP, and 808 also delivered impressive rounds, showcasing their golfing prowess. Glenzo's game was highlighted by some long drives and accurate iron shots, which kept him in contention throughout the day. BDP, known for his short game, dazzled with several clutch putts that saved par on multiple occasions. Meanwhile, 808's round was characterized by a blend of power and finesse, as he executed some remarkable shots from difficult lies.

The camaraderie among the golfers was palpable, with friendly banter and mutual encouragement adding to the day's enjoyment. The beautiful weather and pristine condition of the Cedar Glen course only enhanced the experience, making it a memorable outing for all involved.

As the sun set over the lush greens of Cedar Glen, the participants gathered to celebrate their rounds and share stories of the day's highlights. While FoxholeP took the top honors, it was clear that the true winner was the spirit of the game and the joy of spending a day on the course with good friends.

In the end, it was a fantastic day of golf at Cedar Glen, leaving everyone looking forward to the next round and the chance to improve their game and share more unforgettable moments on the course.

The so called "manager" treated me and my friends very disgusting, she is definitely letting the power get to her head. We had 3 golfers and one guy that wanted to watch and understand the game better, the manager quickly said no if they aren't playing they can't go out. One of the guys stated that they will just pay for the extra guy to watch and she said no. Then we proceeded to tell her okay he'll play we have an extra set in the car and then she proceeded to say no first timers if they want to learn go to the driving range so we had to leave as a whole

The course is in shambles year round and you can tell they put little to no maintenance in or care about how it looks. You'll never see a grounds crew worker while playing.

The staff refused to allow me to book my last tee time over the phone because he couldn't hear what I was saying and got frustrated and hung up. Extremely unprofessional.
I'll never bother again! Don't waste your money. Every time I play I wait 15/20 on the 3rd hole. It ruins the round! Look at all of these people waiting!!! No marshal to be found!

Had great time @CedarGlennGolfCourse today. Great 9 holes track.

***2023 Updated review!***
Ive played in a league here for two years straight. I realize this isn't Augusta National, but for the price. $30+ for 9 holes. The tee boxes are poorly kept, and poorly positioned. The fairways for the course are acceptable, the greens however are the worst!!! I've hit all 3 of my wedges, & anywhere from a 5i - 9i into all of these greens. ***FYI - I get plenty of height on my balls. No line drives, I hit down on ball, and compact it)***
Anywho, in all these approach shots almost all of them when hitting the green hit and bounce 4 to 5 feet in the air. The greens are like concrete, except putting on them is like putting on an old carpet. Playing here makes my game far worse. As I have to adjust for the ridiculous conditions. Then when I play anywhere else on weekends, etc. Greens actually have role, and slope, and of course I'm pounding the ball, b/c last time I played was 4 days prior at Cedar Glenn. I'm just gonna call it what it is. Not well kept! I was told years ago it's like a dust bowl, when I showed up 2 years ago. I was surprised it wasn't quite that. So my review reflected such. However after 2 years I've come to see what my friend meant in his own way. It's just a mess! Staff is friendly enough. But for the price idk you could find better place to get in 9 on a weekday afternoon or evening.
Course is in good shape and wasn't busy today. Got 3 pars out of 9 holes, which is good for me!

The course is clearly not maintained, with several of the tee boxes completely made up of dirt. Pace of play was terrible, with groups being sent out immediately after each other, there were 3 groups waiting on the same tee box at times. Our tee time was for 18 holes (twice around the 9 hole course) and this was confirmed by the worker taking payments when we checked in. We paid $40 for the round initially, but were tracked down at the turn and asked to pay for the second round. Unclear why we couldn't pay for the entire 18 holes at once, when our scheduled tee time was for 18.

The administration staff were very compassionate and helpful. The nurses as well as the therapists were wonderful to my dad and very supportive to our family. My dad made many friends during his stay here.
response_from_owner_text: Hello, thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback and rating of our center. We greatly appreciate it and are only a phone call away should you have further inquiries or questions! Best, the team at Chestnut Woods Rehabilitation and Healthcare Center

review_text:
I can't thank the staff enough for all of their care and concern in regards to taking care of my Mom.  Everyone has been so kind, caring and compassionate.  The nursing staff is hard working, compassionate and efficient, i.e. shout out to Carole, Leah, Carla.  I really love them all and I just can't remember everyone's name and I apologize but they know who they are and all of them deserve a raise.   The health aides are amazing.  They are kind and gentle. Shout out to Chauna, I think I may have spelled her name wrong, but they know who she is!!!  She's the best!   The PT staff is awesome, caring, efficient.  Special shout out to Kimmie whose guidance and support has been amazing.
The ladies at the front desk are friendly and kind.  I'll miss seeing their smiling faces and believe me if you need someone to talk to vent to on your way in or out, they listen with a smile and a kind word. This has been one of the hardest times of my life.  I would not have left my beloved Mom in this facility if she was not treated with the utmost respect.  If you have a loved one that needs rehab, do not hesitate to send them here.

The nurses are socializing while the family visiting rooms have dried up food all over them that had to be a mess all day. Both toilets had dried up feces on them. They only allow patients to shower twice per week despite having accidents.
Patients report staff never brought their dinner. A relative has filthy drawers they don't bother to clean. Staff rude to my preteen daughter because her brother has a disability and accused her of making noise she didn't make. They illegally told a disabled person they can't visit. This place is horrible.
response_from_owner_text: Hello, C. H., on behalf of Chestnut Woods Rehabilitation and Healthcare Center we are sorry to hear of any dissatisfaction you may have experienced with us. This is a fantastic trail just outside of Boston. This trail specifically is VERY rock heavy with a lot of parts sending you up and down rock formations! There are a lot of offshoots of the trail, so it is easy to accidentally get off the trail. But you just have to pay attention to where you are going!

2023-11-30 thu, Parked at Fellsway East. a nice walk counterclockwise, flowing the white blazes, pretty much alone. dry fallen leaves slippery.  confusing paths around Pinnacle Rock.
2023-09-15 fri, Parked at Flynn Rink.  hiked clockwise, better counterclockwise, for the later from 2-7 o'clock harder, more rugged and easier to be loss.  Thus, get it over first.
2022-11-02 wed, a gorgeous day with beautiful fall views.  my 6th time on Rock Circuit Trail.  every time lost my bearing circling around, especially around Pinnacle rock area.
2022-06-29 wed, trees and leaves so dense, many parts unrecognizable.  a really nice half-day trail.
2022-02-09 a beautiful day out there for a wonderful workout.  Cleats or spikes a must.  meandering to seek white blazes in snow.  luckily others' tracks visible. detour rounding MWRA, the hike about 7.5 miles.
2021-05-17 a nice half-day workout. parked Fellsway east and went counterclockwise, pretty much alone.  1st hour is more rocky than the rest.
a pleasant walk, about 4.5 flat miles loop; not busy, mostly well marked with white blazes.

This is a nice and easy trail with some great views of the city. If you are following the trail, beware because it's poorly marked. Use alltrails with gps or a map to avoid straying too far from the paths.

Moderately hard track, that tries to hit every high point in the area.
Lots of fun, very of-the-beaten-track.
Not trivial to navigate but sure as heck worth it!
It's moderately strenuous, lots of rolling hills and some rock climbing, loved the skyline view and waterfall few days after it rained.

Super easy, nice trail that is mostly walking.  Some very slight up and down, very gradual and I think this would be doable for just about anyone who has ever walked a wilderness path before.  You can take the Rock Circuit trail the entire way, or go in and out on other trails.  I would 100% recommend using the Alltrails app on your phone, it makes it really easy to spot the trails and know where you're going.  They're not marked poorly (Rock Circuit was white when I went), but the fact that they overlap other trails often makes it a little confusing.  ALSO BRING BUG SPRAY!!  I read reviews about mosquitos and shrugged it off, and have to many bites to count now - so definitely bring some spray.
